Reviews.Title: “Homey Stay”
Reviews.Author: rocknrollreyes
Reviews.Content: Stayed here thrice already, and everytime was a spledid stay. we even got rooms for early check-in at 8am (though they gave us the old rooms but it was still okay)! Location is good walking distance to the Esplanade, Raffles and the IT Mall

Reviews.Title: “We loved it.....by 3”
Reviews.Author: julesten10
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 days , this being our first time to Singapore. After reading all reviews on this hotel we made the decision to stay here with the Crystal Club package. From club check-in on the 10th floor we were made to feel like family. Tiffany and all club staff were fantastic. Our room was cosy but there was three of us. The location of this hotel is perfect. The MRT is a 5 min walk away, but if you like walking as I do you can walk to China town one way and Orchard Road the other. I ventured out at night and felt safe. Clarke Quay was the best for all food styles and night clubs. So many open air bars too choose from. Yes will return to both Singapore and Grand Park City Hall.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay for Holiday with family.”
Reviews.Author: Geraldine V
Reviews.Content: It was a great place to stay. Excellent customer service, very helpful and polite front office with ever welcoming staff with a smile. I would recommend this hotel for people staying there with family as it's very central for shopping, restaurants, and public transport. It has a good in-house restaurant and bar, swimming pool, spa and gym. You don't need to organize your trip in Singapore, as their friendly staff will take time to make sure you know what you need to do while you there in Singapore. I would definitely recommend this Hotel to everyone I know, as I had a good experience and one that we'll remember for years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Crystal Club makes business travel easier”
Reviews.Author: robilliards
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth stay at the GPCH and clearly it works for me. It is convenient, has great staff and even in the short time I have been using it, feels a bit like a home away from home. The Crystal Club is really handy and while I would normally avoid these type of 'extras', this Club delivers excellent value. I'm sure there are cheaper places to stay, but I doubt there are any better. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “4 days in singapore”
Reviews.Author: dororuss
Reviews.Content: If you are staying at this grand hotel be sure to talk to bob the concierge he is a wealth of knowledge and made us feel very much at home, All the staff that we encounted were very oblieging and nothing was a trouble, the food at the restaurants was fantastic although we did eat out quite a bit. Dont bother having a premix singapore sling at Raffles ask Angel the bartender to make you a real one they are fantastic. the rooms are comfortable and well sizes although the bathroom is quite tight for 2 people at once

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Seeing Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Lucy H
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located, just 2 mins from the MRT from which you can pretty much go anywhere, 5-8minutes walk from the Swisshotel at City Hall ( where you can take shuttes to both Universal Studios in Sentosa Island (not sure on the departure times) & Singapore zoo (9.20am &12.20pm departure) if you are foreign tourist). Also for nighttime walking after the MRT is closed it is not too far gander from Clarkes Quay & One Raffles place. Staff were pleasant and the concierge talkative and helpful when asking for advice on planning trips to the various places. Luggage was safely kept and a room was offered when I came back to freshen up before going to the airport which was welcome after a days of trekking aroudn the zoo and chinatown! Breakfast was good- a wide variety, a little bit pricey but no complaints. Quiet at nighttime which is a must for me as I'm a light sleeper. Plus the kingsize bed was very comfortable. One thing I will crib about is the lighting, there is no "main" light in the section of the room which is a pity as it makes the room quiet dark in the evening. Bathroom is a little bit small and could do with a little bit of a face lift.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: Y L
Reviews.Content: I had weekend stay recently being blessed by a public holiday which falls on a Friday. Spend 2 nights at the Hotel as it was close to the variety of malls and the Esplanade Theatre as we had tickets for a show there. The check-in was smooth with smiles and being a gym freak, I headed to the GYM for a workout. The facilities of the GYM are awesome, being substantially equipped and there are trainers sharing tips on how to get a fruitful workout. I enjoyed the overall services rendered by the Hotel staff and it wasn't a disappointment for locals to have their staycation. Get the right deals and room, Go for that wonderful time with your love one!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: AvrilScottishBorders
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel - very clean and spacious room. Breakfast was good with a large choice although busy at times but it is a large hotel. Good location a short walk from Clark Quay and an abundance of restaurants and shops. Staff very pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: EspanOla_12
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel 31st March 2012 for 2 nights on our way to Malaysia only wish we had stayed longer!!! this was our first visit to Singapore and would definitely return to this hotel. The hotel has MRT station 2 mins walk away, 5 minutes walk to Raffles hotel and many shops bars/restaurants nearby. A complex called Chimes 5 mins walk away which has large selection of bars restaurants within.(from outside can be deceiving need to go in and be pleasantly surprised by the amount on offer!!) Staff at the hotel were very helpful and friendly. We were upgraded to a superior room which was fabulous. We have to say a particulat thank you to "Bob" on concierge desk who was a fountain of knowledge and extremely helpful providing loads of info and advice. Fab hotel, staff unfortunately we do not remember names of the other staff members. Would definitely recommend this hotel. Fabulous!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: mkumar7772001
Reviews.Content: Very good stay for five days .......located centrally .....city hall mrt is just a few walk away.....good breakfast fresh fruits....we were on the 7th floor view was good...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Tomago
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel all the time - but I really didn't want to tell you about it. Why? Because you'll want to stay there too when you are in Singapore and then I won't be able to get a room. This hotel has a wonderful staff, especially the bell, concierge and front desk team. They take special care of your things and your needs. I recommend this hotel - and if you can, get a room on the 9th or 10th floor in the Crystal Club. It's a small upgrade cost, but most of those rooms have recently been remodeled and they are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable & convenient”
Reviews.Author: GMcE6018
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 6 nights at Grand Park City Hall, holidaying with a girlfriend. We had a confirmed booking for a deluxe Crystal Club twin room. The hotel website advertises Crystal Club rooms as "exclusively located on the top floors" and also states that all guest rooms "overlook Singapore’s Civic District or the lush greenery of Fort Canning Park". Check in was friendly and efficient and we were told our room was on the 6th floor (the hotel has 10 floors) at the time we did not question this. I was surprised that we were not shown to our room, which although quite spacious and obviously recently updated, was always dark and the view was of a concrete wall. If you stood close to the window and craned your neck, you could see part of the building across the road and its carpark. Housekeeping staff and the concierge were always very helpful and friendly. Extra towels and new toilet rolls were delivered promptly, though as a previous traveller commented, toilet rolls were not replaced even when one was empty and the other almost so. The Crystal Club amenities were very good and worth the extra cost, though the staff were not as friendly/helpful as I would have expected - maybe they reserve their best hospitality for business travellers? My friend and I were there for 6 nights, but never addressed by name. After a few days we queried why we were on the 6th floor. We were told it was because there had not been any vacant twin rooms on the Crystal Club floors when we checked in, though we had not been advised of this at check in, or given the option of a king room. Fortuitously a twin room on the club floor was available so we moved and had a view! It took a while to get used to not needing to turn on the lights all the time. Overall the hotel was fine. Breakfast was very good and the hotel's location was perfect for us as we used the MRT frequently and City Hall station is only around the corner, it is also a very short walk to Clarke Quay. Wait and door staff were fantastic and the massage I had at the spa was heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely mix of luxury and friendliness”
Reviews.Author: tim_m
Reviews.Content: Arriving by taxi from the cruise terminal we wondered what was in store for us. The hotel staff rushed to unload the taxi before we could reach for our cases, then checked us in despite our being two hours early: luggage would be delivered to our room as soon as available, while we should relax in the spacious (and atmospheric) main hall (in fact we nipped round to Raffles Hotel 100 yards away for a nice expensive Singapore Gin Sling). On returning we found our luggage in our room which was spacious, comfortable (double king size bed!) and well-appointed. Throughout our stay nothing was too much trouble for the friendly concierge who pointed us in the direction of trips, advised on airport transfer etc etc. Breakfast was included and featured everything one could wish for - the traditional western cooked variety, different oriental specials daily, proper juices, tasty bread, croissants etc. We had little need to eat out afterwards. Other reviews comment negatively on the reception staff: we found the exact opposite - friendly smiles, help with whatever was needed and so on. We dined in one night (convinced to do so by the 20% discount voucher offered to guests). We chose the bar option which saved money as the meals seemed to arrive direct from the restaurant. My steak was one of the best i've had in years, washed down by two glasses of excellent red wine (2 for 1 happy hour offer), while a beautiful young lady sang a selection of Carpenters songs (extremely well) accompanied by a proficient pianist. Nothing is perfect of course - the bathroom decor was a little tired - but this wasn't far off; our homeward flight was at 2.00 am but the staff made the hours after checkout pass quickly by looking after our luggage, providing a free hospitality room (with shower, TV etc), summoning a taxi to the airport and again loading our luggage: all in all one of our best hotel experiences ever.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Denwick
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel, very central to MRT, shopping, Boat Quay/Clarke Quay, Marina Bay not far. Rooms are comfortable, quiet and clean and staff are there when you need them. Great little bar with live music on one side or a quieter spot to relax on the other. Hotel is situated away from main streets so there's no noise or hustle & bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: ljane456
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days at this hotel on business in Feb 2012. I found the location excellent - close to metro & key attractions. The hotel itself was a bit worn, and the room was very small for the price. Buffet breakfast was very well done, but other dining at the hotel was not as impressive. Front desk staff were slow and unfriendly on check-in, but super on check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Sel2223
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a 3 night stay at Grand Park City Hall - the final stop on an extended holiday in Asia and Australia! The main positives for this hotel are its value for money and its location - walking distance to Clarke Quay, Boat Quay, the Esplanade and Raffles Hotel and within easy reach of Chinatown, Orchard Road and Little India (by public transport or taxi). The hotel lobby is very impressive and is quite art deco in style with lots of dark wood and rich fabrics. We were slightly disappointed with check-in as we had grown accustomed to warm welcomes across Asia and that was sadly lacking here - the female receptionist who checked us in wasted no time on pleasantries and was not exacly helpful. Check in took about 30 seconds...we were asked for a credit card and told to enter the pin into a card machine (we later found out through our internet banking that S$150 had been taken as a security deposit but it would have been nice to have been told this at the time), we were then handed a key with no explanation of how to get to our room or where the lifts were etc and the receptionist walked off without so much as an 'enjoy your stay'. I am happy to say that things got much better from this point...our room was very nice, decorated in a similar style to the main hotel areas and surprisingly spacious - the bed was HUGE. The bathroom was lovely with a great selection of toiletries and essentials plus dressing gowns/slippers etc for use during our stay. There was an iron and ironing board and a safe which was free to use. Unfortunately, the lighting in the room was very poor. Our room was a non-smoking one on the 7th floor with a nice view to the front of the hotel, be aware that the main fire and ambulance station is located here though so unfortuntely loud sirens could be heard a lot during our stay. This in itself is not the hotels fault but the soundproofing in the rooms is virtually non-existent, aside from the constant sirens, we could also hear everything from the room next door and the corridor outside plus 'chatter' coming from the street below! Breakfast was not included in our room rate and we didn't eat in the hotel during our stay as there are so many great places in the immediate vicinity of the hotel. Singapore is famous for its street food and we particularly enjoyed a couple of meals at the food court opposite fort canning park just around the corner from the hotel (its name escapes me but it was very cheap and seemed to be a favourite with the locals!) We did have coffee and cake at the hotel deli which was lovely. We didn't use the pool or leisure facilities as we had so much we wanted to see and do in Singapore...our flight was late at night on our last day so we had hoped to lounge round the pool a bit after we had checked out but we were told this was not possible as you need to be a current guest to use the facilities. The hotel did, however, hold onto our luggage all day and allowed us to use a room for 30 mins so we could take a shower and get changed. The concierge were very good and alway happy to help. There is no free wifi in the hotel but there is a cheap internet cafe minutes from the hotel (just down the escalators to the left when you leave the hotel, opposite peninsula plaza). Despite a couple of negative points, we did enjoy our stay at Grand Park City Hall and thought the location was excellent. If the rate was good, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “luxury hotel at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Kelley M
Reviews.Content: The cheapest hotels in Singapore are not much cheaper than a very nice hotel such as Grand Park City Hall. I would recommend spending $10-20 more dollars for a dramatic improvement in hotel quality. The location of this hotel is excellent, with many attractions within walking distance and several MRT stations nearby. However, finding reasonably food in the immediate area, particularly for breakfast, was difficult (the hotel breakfast is quite expensive).

Reviews.Title: “A Good Start to our Asian Holiday”
Reviews.Author: John T
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Singapore we were recommended the Grand Park City Hall as being good value for money and in a good location for the Quays. We were not disssapointed. While not a top end five star hotel the room was comfortable and clean. Unfortunaltly there was builing work going on in the immediate area of the Hotel while we were there. The positon is such that both Boat Quay and Clarke Quay are within walking distance as is the Esplanade area. The standard of service was very helpful and friendly and the Breakfast while being a buffet was good with a wide choice. The only niggle I would have is that WI-Fi is only available in the lobby area and not in the rooms. The overall verdict is that if you are looking for a comfortable hotel near the waterfront this is a very good option. If you are into shopping then probably a location nearer Orchard Road would be more suitable.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid unless you have no choice”
Reviews.Author: Subrus
Reviews.Content: They charge a bomb for a room which has basic facilities. Carpets are musty. No wifi. No phone on your writing desk. Dreary decor. A seedy mall nearby. Perhas the only redeeming feature is their service and the fact that it is walking distance from City Hall station. But then again this is true for most hotels in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “No value for money!”
Reviews.Author: FJBoersma
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at this hotel, the lobby was very impressive. Once we got into the room, it was an utter disappointment. The room smelled really bad! We reserved a superior room since all hotels in Singapore are very expensive, and this was the best price we managed to find. But, it was so small that it barefly fit our luggages, and the baby bed which we ordered. Not only that, internet is payable at a ridiculous price of more than S$20 a day (12 euros)! We found that they provided unnecessary toiltetries in the bathroom, so full that we had little space to put our own toiletries there. They could have just reduced all these ridiculous bottles in the bathroom, and charge us with cheaper room price instead with free wifi! In addition, the unnecessary qty of the mini-bar, it was so full, that it took up all the place at the bar. We needed the space to put up our baby's bottles, milk and to do the boiling that we had to move the potato chips & nuts (they're pretty expensive anyway if one consume one of those!) to the cabinet. Singapore in general is charging too expensive for hotels, and we find this a real pity. Most hotels in this country do not provide the key factors needed by travellers, like free wifi, and space for families with children. We are very disappointed at the bad condition of the room in this hotel, and the bad service (the non-chalant attitude of the staff, and keep repeating what you think that might come out of a script!).

Reviews.Title: “Very good location reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Jfeil
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay. Very nice executive lounge. Staff was very friendly and helpful, food in lounge good, nice lobby bar. Very close to public transport. A bit loud during the day due to construction in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DPSun
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff in the lobby and reception, the location is just right not too busy or quite. You could find everything you need by walking distance. The only negative impact is the breakfast restaurant, the staff does not attend to you and you are left asking everyone where you can sit. Not much of a choice at the breakfast buffet, the service and food quality could be improved. The room is clean but needs refurbishment, it looks very tired and old! The room service food and service was great. A nice hotel to stay for a short shopping break and not worry about the facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly& helpful”
Reviews.Author: manasr408
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel great location near City Hall MRT, the hotel staff are very friendly & helpful. Restaurant is very good , the bar as well with a piano & singer are very good. Pool & warm water jacuzzi are really nice , my kids like it very much..overall its a great hotel , we will stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Rising Hotel Group”
Reviews.Author: Shimao
Reviews.Content: Never had we before booked a room with this Park Hotel Group, but the Chinese New Year limited leftover choices for our late booking drove us to this option. But we had the luck of the dragon and got a really nice newly renovated room allocated by very friendly front desk staff. The location is very central with everything around you at your doorstep. We especially enjoyed the rather small looking pool, which had two hidden treasures in the very green and lush views towards Canning Fort Hill and secondly a hidden and green outdoor Jacuzzi. All in all Singapore efficiency at its best.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient located hotel.”
Reviews.Author: cochleartraveller
Reviews.Content: The City Hall MRT is just a short walk away. which makes this hotel one of the most centrally located to most corners of Singapore by MRT or bus. However for night life, a short cab ride will be needed to prevent one from breaking into sweat! Generally a good hotel, but do not hope for any thing too much for views.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff and a great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Andrey B
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Grand Park City Hall for the 2nd time. The first time we were here in Jan 2010, then came back in Jan 2012 after staing a few days in Swissotel Stamford. Have to admit that it was not worth trying something else and paying almost double price for nothing really special: everything we needed was in Grand Park City Hall and at a much more attractive price! The location is great: we loved walking in the Fort Canning Park, which is just across the road from the hotel's doors; there is a great choice of restaurants near the Clarke Quay and tourist bus stops just 2 min walk. The staff is very friendly, there was always a person at the reception desk, who could answer our questions before we left the hotel for a walk in the city. And, of course, check-in and check-out were very fast and without any problems. We asked for the room with a view to the Armenian church and we recieved it! The room was great - quite big and not dark (as mentioned here in one of the reviews). Bathroom was clean and all facilities worked perfectly well. The breakfast was great - a big choice of meals and seems to be worth the price we paid. Another advantage - free internet and no surcharge for a child 4 years old: we were given a separate bed, which was big and very comfortable for our son. When booking a hotel we found a better deal on the hotel's site - looks like they are not willing to pay extra commissions to tripadvisor, booking.com and others. So I recommend you checking the price on the hotel's site before making the final confirmation.

Reviews.Title: “Value hotel with a good location”
Reviews.Author: YEWJIN2000
Reviews.Content: The last I stayed in this hotel was many years ago. This trip was a personal trip which was not at a company's expense but my own. The reason I chose this hotel was that it's a stone throw away to Clarke Quay, Raffles City (Robinson Shopping) and SMRT. Rooms are decent, clean and I have to agree with a lot of reviewers is that it's a little dark but overall I had a pleasant stay. Check in was a breeze - no hassle, my booking through Agoda was in order and only a $50 deposit which I paid in cash. Checking out was also a breeze. Off peak season perhaps. Returned my $50. Grand Park City Hall will remain by best value for money and location hotel in Singapore. Taxi from the airport terminal 1 was $20. When it was time to leave Singapore I took the SMRT to the airport. That costed me $2 (after getting back my deposit for the card)

Reviews.Title: “Might as well have stayed at a hostel...”
Reviews.Author: wulili
Reviews.Content: ... in fact, I've stayed at hostels that provided better service than this place! While the check-in process may have gone more or less smoothly, it was all that followed that provides the fodder for this review. 1. This old house: Bathrooms eventually smell, but this one smelled as you walked in the room. Could it have been mold? Maybe. Regardless, the bathroom needs some method of ventilation and perhaps even a mold inspector to ensure that there isn't anything else lurking on those walls. 2. In the shadows: The lighting in the room, overall, was lacking. Only during the day, when one could draw the curtains, was it possible to almost see everything in one's room. And barely. The rooms require a flashlight. 3. Drip drip: One of the joys of staying at a hotel is that you don't have to worry about all of those things that might happen at home, like a leaky faucet, or even worse, a leaky air-conditioning unit. This was not just a leak, it was a puddle that accumulated on the marble floor. Which leads to... 4. Slip and slide: Upon entering the room with the "light" on, and not expecting what was coming, I slipped on the puddle of water just before the carpet began. Yes, a full on fall, which could have been quite bad, had I had fragile bones or not managed to balance enough to not hit my head. 5. Horrible service: So only on the THIRD phone call did anyone bother to bring ice to the room and then that person was the one to call someone to come and fix the air-conditioning. It took THREE phone calls, after they were told, "Someone slipped in the room due to a leak from the air-conditioner." You would think that a slip in anyone's property would lead to a manager coming in to check, at the very least. Perhaps even an upgrade. Free room service. Profuse apologies and the offer of getting you a doctor. But no, three phone calls later (four, if you count the one from their staff), and only then was the dripping remedied. And, no sight of a manager, at all, to see if everything as ok. So, overall, the Grand Park City Hall requires, well, too much to list. So I encourage you not to be tempted to check out to see if it's true...

Reviews.Title: “My second home in Singapore.”
Reviews.Author: Jennykuan
Reviews.Content: I travel often to Singapore for business issue. And had been staying in this hotel for more than three years. From my personal point of view, this hotel is the best hotel in Singapore, because of the personal touch by their staff during my stay. An example,is last September, I need a catch an early morning flight to china. I remember a lady, miss Melinda, arranged the morning cab for me. Their prompt and swift action to arrange the check out make life so easy for me. And the moment, I step out the lift and rushing to the cab, a mr Leonard handed me a bag of morning goodies, mineral water and just steam hot dim sum, bread, cake, tissue, etc. Gosh, I was overwhelmed by their attentive care and thoughts. Briefly, I said thank you and dash to changi airport. After I have boarded all my luggages, I was hungry and thirsty. Thank you very much Leonard for your early morning goody bag. And many many more beautiful moments staying in this hotel. And by the way, do you know that they serve the best Cantonese food. Please look for mr shek. He knows how to prepare each meal for you. Just tell him you are tired, he would prepare good that after consuming, you are revitalized. I think the tonic is his smile, careful thoughts for each evening menu and etc. Thanks, mr shek for the wonderful food. And after, pop into my ever clean and cosy room for my beauty sleep. I strongly recommend this hotel to any traveller. Yup, not forgetting their concierge. Another best concierge service in Singapore. Thanks bob and your team of concierge colleagues. Syabas.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service”
Reviews.Author: MAFC
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights over Christmas for the second year running and both years have been very happy. We arrived at about 8am and they had managed get us a room available and it was upgraded too. This was about as good as it comes after a 14 hour flight. We looked at other hotels in the area but decided that for the price and knowing the location its is a great choice. It is a reasonably large hotel so the service is not too personal but it is efficient and the small bar is a nice place to end your evening. The breakfast buffet is good and the pool is a nice place to spend a couple of hours when you don't want to be running everywhere. The main thing is the location. You are a couple of minutes walk from City Hall MRT which can take you all over the city including straight up Orchard Road if that is you thing. Alternatively you can walk to Boat Quay/Clark's Quay in about 5 minutes and the Marina Bay area in about 10-15. This year they have free internet which is good. Just something to note that while it is WiFi in the main ground floor it is through a LAN cable in the rooms which is not great for iPhones/iPads but fine for laptops. The rooms are clean and a decent size. We were upgraded to what I think was a club room so not sure about the rest of them. The gym is also well stocked with machines and the spa is lovely. My only slight issue was the blackout blind would not quite close at the join and the air con from the room next door was noisy. These were very minor issues and we did not bother to report them.

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: eldag
Reviews.Content: Great location. Good value. Friendly staff. The bathroom is tiny but confy. The bedroom a bit dark (the lights were broken but the service came and fixed them immediately) Amazing buffet breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: blazing_aces
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of days on the way back from Malaysia. The rooms are clean and reasonably sized but are smaller than other hotels. The staff were friendly and provided great service. The breakfast buffet is excellent and one of the better ones I've been to. In terms of location, if you want to shop at Orchard Road, there are plenty of other hotels that are much closer. But if you don't mind walking and taking MRT this is an okay location. It is also walking distance to Clarke Quey..

Reviews.Title: “Good for business travel or sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: BrownBlackstone
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week while my husband was in town on business, and my business was sightseeing. Well located, very easy to walk to many restaurants, hawker centers, and sights but equally easy to hop on public transportation. Since we booked at the last minute, the only room available was a "Club" room, although it wasn't located on the club level. We did enjoy the perks of the Club lounge, including the breakfast, cocktail hour, and free wifi - it's worth checking to see if this is available. Our first room had a funny odor (sort of moldy), and we switched mid-week to a room on the club level which was very similar and still had a strangely spicy scent. Perhaps we just weren't used to the cleaning supplies they used? I used the well-equipped fitness center, and was usually the only one there. The pool area is adjacent, and it is a very small pool, but it was nice to sun by it. I'd stay here again, but probably only on business - I think it was priced a little above my personal budget.

Reviews.Title: “I plan to stay in this hotel again when I am in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: aforeignaffair
Reviews.Content: I have only good things to write about this hotel. We stayed for 3 nights from 24-27 Dec 2011. It's ideally located in an area where local transport is readily available. There are several malls nearby where you can do a bit of shopping and eat out. It's quite near the Marina Bay Sands where we went to watch Wicked. The rooms are quite nice and average sized. Twin beds are roomy and comfortable. The bathroom has a tub and shower. The service is was very good. The concierge was quite helpful and patiently answered all our questions on which places were the best for what we were looking for, as well as how to get from one place to another using local transport. Staff were quite courteous and eager to assist. The room rate is not cheap considering that breakfast was not included, but it was still worth the stay. I would recommend it to anyone wanting to stay at a good hotel in the heart of Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay on the Club floor”
Reviews.Author: HabsGo
Reviews.Content: Very nice location, we were very close to the fireworks on New year's eve. Close to lots of nice areas to visit. We received great service, especially in the Club lounge for breakfast and drinks. Nice gym and outdoors swimming pool. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “CarolH”
Reviews.Author: carol283
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed by the standard of service we received from all the staff, especially Ms Kripa at the club floor. The staff were friendly and keen to ensure we enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The location is great, close to MRT, Clarke Quay, the National Museum etc - all walking distances. Our king size bed was very comfortable but the bathroom was a little small and only one person at a time can fit, but having a full size bath was very nice to relax in. We would stay at this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “I will come back again”
Reviews.Author: Pramila14
Reviews.Content: I would like to comment about the great experience me and my husband had when we stayed in Singapore. I was recommended this place by a mate and we have no regrets. We were warmly welcomed by a staff Miss Kripa at the club floor where we were staying on. All the other staff were very friendly and took care of us for the few nights we were there. The rooms and service were top notch.I will surely recommend this place to fellow Kiwis that go to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Ajain13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 Nights from Dec 23 onwards. We checked in at 4 am in the morning. We were given a room to rest till our allocated room was made ready. All this at no extra cost! We were in a corner room with large windows , there is no view as such in this hotel. The room are average size, bathroom is clean and good. Bedsheets are clean. The location of this hotel is very good in that it has shopping malls, Merlion, Esplanade all within walking distance. The hotel has shuttle service to Orchard Rd which is convenient There are atleast 4-5 Indian Veg restaurants nearby , oveall a lively location. The Hotel staff is courteous and service is good. Did not have breakfast at hotel so no comments there. Improvement points: The housekeeping can be better (blankets and sheets were left half done though it was rectified on being pointed out, the towels were in tatters...., the reception phone is rarely picked up . Checkin/Checkout was smooth.

Reviews.Title: “Stay during Dec 2011”
Reviews.Author: mary w
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant hotel, with friendly and accomodating staff. Buffet breakfast excellant. Club lounge superb with nibbles and wine each evening.....very generous with the wine. Again staff very friendly and always smiling. Choice of TV programmes not so good but hotel provided me with a dvd player to watch dvd's I had brought with me as they wouldn't play on company laptop. Close to Raffles city mall and FuNan for the shop aholics! I was here on business and didn't have too many chances to sight see.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You Mr. Sadi Sariman For Everything!”
Reviews.Author: dicktopps
Reviews.Content: I have been to Singapore many many times and have always stayed at the Phoenix Hotel that was located on Orchard. It was torn down about three/four years ago and was my little gem in Singapore until this last holiday. I have found another gem and it is the Grand Park City Hall Hotel. I stayed there for 4 days and nights on the club floor. The staff was wonderful and all of my needs were met especially by the men working the concierge desk and the head concierge, Mr. Sadi Sariman. I want to express a big thanks and appreciation to this wonderful man, for going that extra step in taking care of mailing three parcels back to my homes in the US. All arrive safely. To Sadi! The head Concierge, thanks for everything in getting my packages back to me in the US. I look forward to seeing you and the wonderful staff at your great hotel in the future. I also would love to add that to anyone looking for a gem in Singapore, The Grand Park City Hall Hotel is ideal. Singapore is a costly/pricey city but I found the hotel great for value over the more pricier places such as Fullerton House or Raffles. Mr. Topps

Reviews.Title: “Top drawer service”
Reviews.Author: Dawnyz
Reviews.Content: Quality 4 star hotel in perfect location for exploring the city. We were offered an upgrade at a reasonable price to include a club room & access to the excellent club lounge where in the early evening there's unlimited drinks & delicious canapés in comfortable surroundings on the top floor. The hotel staff were extremely helpful & knowledgeable. We would recommend the hotel to anybody looking to enjoy the best that Singapore has to offer. Very close to City Hall MRT station - within walking distance!

Reviews.Title: “Magical Stay”
Reviews.Author: scotmankiwigirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a welcoming sight after our long flight from London. We were given a very warm welcome from Leonard, the Customer Services Manager who was fantastic throughout our stay. We were very pleased with our room on the executive level and enjoyed the amazing buffet breakfast. The hotel was very spacious and decorated with lovely xmas decorations and all the staff were very polite and helpful. The hotel is in a good location, near a train station and taxis are available outside the door and don't cost much to get anywhere. Would definitely stay here again and we thoroughly enjoyed our first time in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Average 4star hotel”
Reviews.Author: CornwallDolly
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel really, just your average 4 star with no atmophere whatsoever. Room clean, good location, good service etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: RichardPurley
Reviews.Content: Stay on the executive level which has a good lounge. Rooms a bit small but well appointed not great value but efficient. Have stayed on several occassions however on the last visit and arriving in the early hours my room was overbooked and with little apology was bumped off the executive level. Very poorly handled.

Reviews.Title: “Comments about lodging and services”
Reviews.Author: Climatechangestudent
Reviews.Content: The attendance is regular...they are really good attending at the reception hall, but by phone from your room is unsatisfactory. The choices for breakfast are excellent. The room quality is very good. Quality of TV services from the TV set is very bad....very few choices, some channels are not neat and there are no PPV services. The gym and swimming pool are not available in the early morning hours. The internet service is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant service, Fantastic location and Vry Good Ambience”
Reviews.Author: JoeMMuscat
Reviews.Content: We as a group of twenty people stayed in this hotel for four days during the first week of November, 2011. Most of us were first time visitors, and hence wanted to stay in the centre of attractions. This hotel is ideally located, very near to good shopping malls, esplanade, train station and lot of other attractions. The service is excellant, all of the staff seems to be highly professional and at the same time very pleasant and friendly -whether it is the desk staff, room boys, bell boys or the attendant who guide you to your table for breakfast. The hotel is kept very clean and the lobby& rooms neat and tidy. On our last day at the hotel, we vacated the rooms in the morning and some of us came back to the hotel by 3 PM. Our airport pick up was arranged at 5PM. Within ten minitues of our arrival at the lobby, the staff offered us a complimentary room, seeing that we had an infant with us and some of us very tired after some hectic activities at Sentosa. We didnot know that such a facility was available there and hence didnot demand it, but the friendly and considerate concierge staff on duty at the lobby offered it to us. We really liked this hotel and sure will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and great location close to Boat Quay”
Reviews.Author: jg161
Reviews.Content: I have to say that most of the other reviews are pretty much all saying the same. Great location, just a 10 min stroll down to BoatQuay, close to train station and various shopping destinations like Funan Plaza, Chijmes etc. Staff were great; loaned me a plug adapter and bumped me to club floor. Note to others, as i later found out, this doesn't entitle you to the lounge on level10, but the staff were very polite when they told me off for having breakfast there :) Rooms are standard hotel rooms, perhaps a little old but I don't travel to sit around admiring the marble in bathroom or the brand of the bar fridge; I found it quite comfortable to work from. Room was about slightly on the small size for a "business floor room" but by no means tiny, with a decent size work desk and large bed (as with all of APAC, it was quite hard). AC was strong and doesn't turn off when out of the room. Bathroom a little on the small side but made up by a decent array of amenities and 2 x bottle complimentary water. Only ate in the hotel once as there is a cheap and cheerful food hall up in Hill Street that I preferred to cesar salads et. al., but I feel the alacarte is a bit pricey compared to what the buffet price (which looks pretty good but didn't partake). I did consume plenty of free beer snacks while consuming somewhat expensive pints at the hotel bar - but if you hit happy hour, it's survivable. All in all, would stay again at the price I paid which was quite reasonable off Agoda.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent friendly service, ok rooms”
Reviews.Author: Seeyalin
Reviews.Content: As a first time traveller to Singapore, I wanted to stay at a location that was central to all the attractions. I definitely got that at Grand Park City Hall! The service was excellent. After a long flight we were able to check in 5 hours early at no extra cost. On the day we were checking out, our flight was very late at night so the hotel allowed us to leave our bags with them, and then pick them up just before we went to the airport. Moreover, they offered us a hospitality room to freshen up before our flight, at no cost. We could not have been more satisfied with the service. The room was clean and neat with all necessary amenities available, and the only problem was that the curtains needed a wash.

Reviews.Title: “The not so lounge”
Reviews.Author: dannyanb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine and the rooms are good. the location is excellent but the service is just not there. this is except the concierge team which is excellent! The lounge team is might be short staffed but the service is below par.

Reviews.Title: “a regular customer review”
Reviews.Author: Fei1943
Reviews.Content: for the last 3 years have been staying 3to 4times a year for periods of up to 2 weeks in this hotel. plusses: great location with short walk to mrt, staff very friendly and helpfull.minus is no wifi in rooms.rooms at floor which are not yet removated are run down.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: David-westermo
Reviews.Content: Friendly hotel with excellent service and at a good location. I do recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great holiday”
Reviews.Author: alister m
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a superior suite, which was an upgrade due to early booking, this was my second time , and it will be my first choice in future, I travel to singapore in november each year for the rugby 7s, but I normally have some extra timeafter our team has gone home, the location is perfect ,the staff are professional, the rooms are modern and spotless, the resturaunt food is delicious, I would not hesitate to recomend the grand park city hall to anyone I meet

Reviews.Title: “Everything was wonderful after the reservation was sorted out”
Reviews.Author: RichardCA
Reviews.Content: It's a wonderful hotel in a great location. However it all started horribly wrong when I booked a club room via their website. I arrived at the hotel only to be told I booked a regular superior room. I was only saved by having a print out of my reservation with me. The next morning, that disaster repeated itself when I went to breakfast only to be told I wasn't entitled to be there. I blew my top and made my displeasure quite clear. A terrible start to my first full day in Singapore. That all changed upon my return to the hotel after a long day of working. An apology waited me and from that point forward, my stay was wonderful. Enhanced service made up for the rocky start, and that fantastic service continued past checkout. Despite the bad start, they redeemed themselves & I would Highly recommend this hotel to one & all.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: ALauHongKong
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at a very convenient place which is close to the City Hall MRT and shopping centre, Raffles City. Service at Conceirge is good. Hotel room is standard in size but a bit old. Bathroom is not big and water is not hot enough. Wifi is not available at room and only available at hotel lobby at a charge. Buffet breakfast is overall satisfactory as there are numerous choices. I do not recommend to stay at this hotel for business due to the limited wifi facility.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: SIMMO62_07
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a deluxe upgrade room on the 9th floor. It was clean and quiet, the service was excellent and the breakfast was varied and plentiful. It was central to the different cultural precincts and the river, with bus stops and taxi rank outside the hotel. Will be staying there again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shrenikdodhia
Reviews.Content: Well placed hotel in the center of the City. Nice Indian restaurants just 5 minutes walk. Metro station "City Hall " very near. Many shopping complex very near. Fire Station Museum just two minutes walk and nice hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “cockroach in e room!!”
Reviews.Author: idahz
Reviews.Content: upon checking in today to e superior room, found a cockroach!!! what a disappointment... never in my entire life, i encounter such incident..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jayamary
Reviews.Content: Very convient,easy accessible and it's like home.With very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore in November”
Reviews.Author: Vince_Chris
Reviews.Content: My wife an myself needed a mental health break from work and as it was also her birthday, we decided to head to Singapore for a week of relaxation. The Grand Park City Hall was recommended by our travel agent and subsequently by a friend of a friend. Getting here was another story, Qantas. Upon arrival we were ushered to the Crystal Club where we were expertly Checked In and offered a welcoming drink, after which we were shown to our very comfortable and well appointed rooms. All of the staff are ever willing and able to help in any way. The hotel is centrally located with the SMRT across the road,short walking distances from many attractions. We will most definitely be coming back and staying here in the not too distant future. At the moment the child bride is enjoying a pedicure

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: Simon63
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located in Coleman Street it is a short walk to the entertainment areas of Clarke and Boat Quays and a short taxi drive to the City. The MTR from the airport stops at City Hall which is a short walk to the hotel and at rush hour or during heavy rain provides a certainty on timing (about 40 minutes) The reception area is light and airy and leads onto a cafe area and a bar. Unfortunately they never seemed to have more than one person on reception (which was also for checking out and cashier) which caused delays. However, the reception staff were polite and helpful. I was upgraded to an 'executive room' (from Superior). Although not very large it had everything required, a large flat television and a good choice of cable channels. There was plenty of wardrobe space and I noticed it included both an iron and ironing board and a small safe. Do people really steal hangers from hotels? I am always annoyed by the two piece variety. The marble bathroom was quite big and included both a bath and separate shower. Four bath towels rather than 2 would be an improvement. The telephone was by the bed and its cord was not quite long enough to be used on the desk. If two phones cannot be justified what about one with a wireless handset so that it can be used when using a laptop at the desk? I was on the 5th floor and the window just had a view of the terrace and pool of another hotel opposite. Higher floors may have better views including over the river or bay. There was an outdoor pool (smallish) which also had a lot of engine noise from the hotel's air conditioners. There was no service to the pool area although I suppose one could ring for room service. Adjacent was a very well equipped gym. There is also a big spa facility on the ground floor which I did not try out. It would be nice if breakfast was included. Lan internet in the room was efficient although some guests were clearly charged for it. All told a pleasurable experince.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, geared for business....good location”
Reviews.Author: dan19460
Reviews.Content: The Grand Park City Hall is where we stayed as a couple for a few days in October as a city break. It had been many years since we had last visited Singapore (actually staying then in the Raffles which I guess was a bit more affordable at that time!) and we were keen to get a hotel in the centre of things. Our previous impression of Singapore had left us with a feeling of a “city without a centre”. Not so now! Grand Park City Hall indeed seemed to be pretty much in the hub of things. Only a block or so from the Raffles and Orchard Road. Walkable to Boat Quay and Clarke Quay. Near the City Hall MRT therefore easy access to Little India, China Town, Marina Bay Sands and the Singapore Flyer (all worth a visit). The hotel clientele is a mix of tourists and business people. You can tell the before 8am breakfast diners are there to work, at later times it is more relaxed as the tourists eat. I think it is a little more geared for business clients, though we had a good time and good service as tourists too. The room we were in had a decent view and was clean and adequately roomy, though not spacious. Not a great deal of storage space though that did not affect us…we only unpacked minimally as we were only there for 4 days at the end of an extended stay in the Far East. Free safe in the room but you pay through the nose for room internet access (business hotel you see!). You can find internet cafes in Little India for a tiny fraction of the hotel’s room internet costs! Unless you are there on business of course when you’ll need the hotel online facilities. Service in the hotel was very good. Special word for Leonard on Reception….he couldn’t do enough to make us welcome. Also gave us a late checkout for a midnight flight at no extra cost as we opted for a twin room rather than a double (less in demand). The girls in the bar and in the breakfast room were also really excellent (with one exception!). Breakfasts were really good with plenty of choice. As stated earlier, the hotel location is ideal. A word of caution if using taxis though. You will always readily get a taxi from the hotel to anywhere. We did find it a problem trying to get a taxi back late evening though e.g. from Little India, where there were hundreds of taxis….all “busy”. One that was “available for hire” wasn’t going our way at that time! The MRT is easy to use, cheap and convenient….so I’d recommend that for central areas. Singapore is very expensive to stay in, and to eat and drink. Places like the Quays are pretty pricy to eat and drink in, though worth seeing. So make the most of the various happy hours in bars, including the Bar in Grand Park City Hall. Taxis not too expensive, MRT cheap. You’ll get better and cheaper meals in “ethnic” areas like Little India and China Town. Great markets in both places too. Strongly recommend Lagnaa restaurant in Upper Dixon St. Little India for superb curries at very reasonable prices. Just don’t be too adventurous on the spice level though! Other suggestions – take a bumboat river trip through all the quays to the marina, and the Botanic Gardens are lovely. Singapore is a wonderfully slick and efficient Westernised City where English is virtually universally spoken. So that’s all great…..but you pay a higher price compared to say Thailand, Malaysia or even Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kristiana T
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business during my first visit to Singapore. The hotel has a great location, felt it very convenient to many of my meetings. The staff was very helpful, the breakfast was plentiful, and the rooms very nice - I even enjoyed a spa treatment at the spa!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Alhgfjo
Reviews.Content: This is my first time in the hotel. I found it conveniently located, very nice and friendly staff, excellend dining and a very nice fitness Center. I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Wonderful Service, Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: michb1974
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel, from the moment we arrived we were wisked off to check in, in the Crystal Club with a wonderfully personal service. One of the Managers C T is all you can imagine a brilliant Hotel manager can be with discrete & personal service that is by far the best we have received. The hotel is in a fantastic location right in the heart of the city with shopping, bars & restaurants all near by. The rooms are spacious & sooo comfortable and clean. I would recommend that anyone traveling to Singapore should stay at this wonderful hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Works well”
Reviews.Author: ismonkuva
Reviews.Content: Good location with all required facilities and executive floor and lounge is very good for it's cost. Good selection for business trip. No complains. Room not new, b ut everything was working well. Internet connections works well. I'll come back later.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business travel”
Reviews.Author: SpeedyMFnGonzales
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Park City Hall for 4 nights on a business trip. Overall level of the hotel is very good, especially the lounge is good value for your money. Service is good and the rooms are very decent. All in all, a very fine place!

Reviews.Title: “Rubbish - you can do so much better in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: loveknot
Reviews.Content: After coming from the Shangri-La in Hong Kong to this, the change was almost unpalatable. The location is good for business (which we were on). The reception area is ok. Check-in: unfriendly and disorganised Rooms: awful. They smell, horrid paint on the walls, small and I got two nasty bites, not a great sleep at all. Breakfast: although busy (tend to be with conferences and bus tours/cabin crew), food wasn't great and neither was the choice. Couldn't wait to get out of here, utter rubbish. I can't comment as a tourist on Singapore but in comparison to other APAC cities, I would avoid it. The over riding factor is that Singapore is boring, hard to say that about a city but I've quickly realised I'm not the only one!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location make for a wonderful stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: brett_mal
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Crystal Club room, well worth the extra $ as you are free to enjoy continental breakfast and cocktails daily, which is something to look forward too. The location is great, around the corner from the City Hall MRT (with great links to Orchard Road & Little India) and a short stroll to China Town. The room was a generous size and nicely furnished, however the bathroom was a little small with no power points. The staff were all AMAZING, so friendly, attentive and ready to go out of their way to help, particularly Jeannnie, and Joey and the others from the Crystal Club. The staff alone make this hotel a place I would love to come back to any time I stay in Singapore. A 5 star experience and one that I would easily recommend to anyone. Also, the foyer smells amazing, very welcoming after stepping in from Singapore's humid streets.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at Grand Park City Hall”
Reviews.Author: stoneybroke_11
Reviews.Content: I have visited Singapore many times over the years. I have stayed at a number of very upmarket hotels but my choice is to stay at the Grand Park City Hall. It is wonderfully located ,close to the River and the MRT and , as always for Singapore ,close to good shopping like Raffles Ciy Square.Good walking is close by,across the park and along the River to places like China Town and Clarke Quay. The hotel ,and its rooms , are comfortable ( more than adequate) and the staff are universally helpful and friendly. Dining in at the hotel is good and the pool is very nice (perhaps except for those who want to use a pool as an exercise device) and the jym is sound. I highly recommend this hotel,it is fairly priced and ,as I have already said, wondefully located-close enough to but not too close to the rush of Orchard Road(you can be there in 10 minutes at little cost using the MRT or a 30 minute alk if you feel that energetic). Mark

Reviews.Title: “Visit Review”
Reviews.Author: Anthony M
Reviews.Content: The standard of accomodation and facilities, customer service and cuisine left nothing to be desired. This is our second stopover in this hotel, and we will again be rebooking for our transit time in Singapore in Oct 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Excellently-located first-class hotel”
Reviews.Author: BenN14
Reviews.Content: With only being in Singapore for a few days, I was looking for a place that was both comfortable and conveninently located. Walking distance to Clarke Quay for great food and atmosphere and a few minutes walk to the MRT stop and Raffles City mall. Clean, high-quality rooms (the only minor issue was the slightly uncomfortable pillows) with excellent service on the Club floor made this first trip to Singapore extremely enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Park City Hall - gave us a great experience on our first trip to Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: Vinay K
Reviews.Content: Grand Park City Hall was a perfect place for a business stay combined with a leisurely long weekend. It is conveninently located near the business district and at a walking distance from attractions, restaurants, etc. We will certainly recommend the Grand Park for our friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Not really 5 star”
Reviews.Author: PJMAustralia
Reviews.Content: A hotel that appears to offer a lot but does not reach that expectation. In reasonably good location and pretty good facilities, it really is a let down when you enter your room. Quite dark with no outlook, apart from the Hotel over the road, and in need of an upgrade to bring the rooms up to a better standard. The room was really the only let down of the Hotel. Staff were really good and had an excellent Cantonese Restuarant and a reasonalbly good smorgasboard restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “You can feel heart-warming hospitality from everyone!”
Reviews.Author: Hiromi M
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Singapore without any hotel reservation, and without even knowing it is the time of Formula 1 in all over the City.. Although the rate for1 night stay was pretty high due to F1 night, everyone in the hotel treated us with great hospitality and support, and it did pay off! We appreciate Mr. Zadi, who was in a managing position for Concierge. We checked out around 10:00 AM, but he was not only willing to keep our luggage until we came back from our 1 day city tour, but also kind enough to let us use an empty room to take a shower at night. That moment, which was 1 hour before our departure from Singapore, gave us a great heart-warming closure for our trip. Everybody in this hotel has just more than a smile on their faces. They know what kind of hotel is good, and what they are supposed to do to improve it! Excellent work. Viva Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, food and room.”
Reviews.Author: nadnut
Reviews.Content: Both my boyfriend and I really enjoyed the staycation at Grand Park City Hall Hotel and were very pleased by the room, food and great service. We’ll definitely be back soon! Pics of the room, hotel available here: http://bit.ly/qdjcte

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: OilRover
Reviews.Content: I visit Singapore about once per year, and this time around I decided to try a different hotel. The Grand Park City Hall in Singapore stood out from the page for its good value and amenities, and great location (I also get a corporate discount at this hotel, but I believe it is still very competetive when compared with other hotels, especially the ones on Orchard Road). I splashed out a little to stay on the Crystal Club Floor, which has its own business lounge that provides cocktails and snacks from 5pm to 7pm (I say snacks, but the array of hot food was actually enough to substitute for dinner), and a varied hot breakfast buffet from 6am to 10am. Add to that the free internet and free two pieces of laundry, and soon the higher price for a club room seems much more reasonable. The hotel's location is very good, sandwiched between Fort Canning Park and the historic Padang. The MRT is just around the corner, and there is a liberal smattering of shops and restaurants within easy walking distance. The hotel lobby area is airy and light, with a cafe/bar at the far end, and plenty of reception space for checking in (although Crystal Club guests check in on the 10th floor). I would not call this hotel a bargain by normal standards, but compared to other similar hotels in Singapaore - where the land price and exchange rate combine to significantly elevate hotel prices - the Grand Park City Hall is a good pick. I would definitely stay there again on the next trip.

Reviews.Title: “I probably got a bad room”
Reviews.Author: Finendandy
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as it was advertised to have free wifi - and found out only upon check-in that wifi is available only in the lobby and other common areas. When I complained about this and asked for a wireless router, they sent one to my room within 5 minutes. They also helped to set it up and did everything with a smile. Other than this, I found the hotel to be getting old and tired. While the room was clean, the age was starting to show through. The thing it has going for it is it's location. A couple hundred metres from the metro station, it convenient enough get to most places within Singapore. For the price, it's sufficiently worth the money but given the number of choices for hotels in Singapore, I'd have to think hard if I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very warm, personalised and caring hotel”
Reviews.Author: Arjun V
Reviews.Content: Excellent food. The food was really to die for...right from the sumptious multi ethnic and multi continental breakfast menu, to the delicious meals for lunch and dinner, I would put the food as their strongest USP. The spa was incredible, with very affordable rates and discounts offered. I enjoyed the fact that it was so centrally located,and you could say right in the Heart of Singapore, very close to any public transport services, and to the main city landmarks and attractions. Very friendly and helpful staff, willing to attend to your every query and every need. I was indeed impressed and can say that i loved staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel service I've experienced!”
Reviews.Author: Brent B
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff is WONDERFUL, from receptionists to cleaners !!! So helpful and friendly. My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 6 weeks for business and vacation. Staff members provided us with loads and loads of useful information such as history, celebrations, food, directions, etc. They are very attentive, pleasant, all smiles and eager to help. We particularly enjoyed the Network Open House held every fortnight or so that we had been invited to and had a chance to mingle to staff members and other guests. The location is smack in the middle of town and practically surrounded by museums, churches and activities. We watched wonderful fireworks on Independence Day from down the street 1 min from the hotel! It is also within walking distance to a few MRT stations and very convenient. The hotel is also practically next door to the Burmese food court with authentic Burmese food. Since we have not been to Burma (Myanmar) and have no plans to go in foreseeable future, so we really felt fortunate to be able to try authentic Myanmar food and chat with the people. I have stayed in many hotels throughout the world. Grand Park City Hall is by far with the best service I've ever experienced! To Melinda, CT and Bernard--you are the best and thank you for making our stay like home away from home and special! B&D

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Paul D
Reviews.Content: Stayed on business for 15 nights. Friendly and helpful staff. Good food. Helpful with wifi etc. Had use of the executive lounge for five nights; very comfortable. Good range of facilities and central location. Good value for money. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel. Executive floor really worth it. Staff were extremely helpful”
Reviews.Author: Wendy A
Reviews.Content: Great location, central to everything. Rooms were spacious and comfortable. The staff from the reception to the exec floor to the concierge were all very friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Charming staff”
Reviews.Author: joaquim_barros
Reviews.Content: Very good location for business or leisure. Charming staff. Excellent lounge service with friendly and polite staff!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Central”
Reviews.Author: dragoon54
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so well placed for many of the sights in Singapore as it is so central. Nearest MRT is City Hall. The best thing about it was the friendliness and helpfulness of all the staff from Reception to Concierge and room service personell. The room was very clean, large and comfortable. The airconditioning worked well and was very quiet. The en-suite was adequate size and a bit dated in the choice of decor, but again it was very clean. Tea and coffee making facilities in the room were a nice touch. I would highly recommend this hotel, and will be returning again on my next trip to Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, well-appointed and reasonably-priced."”
Reviews.Author: mr_jabberjaw
Reviews.Content: I had a spacious, clean, well-appointed room with free internet. Nice view. Efficient, focused, well-trained staff from the bellhop to the concierge to the desk personnel. This hotel is value for money and I will definitely stay here again. Great location (and I love the food court downstairs in the mall--especially the Indian vegetarian spot).

Reviews.Title: “We visited Singapore few times before we love it here. We will rerturn!”
Reviews.Author: 455kaz455
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice the personel friendly and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to start your walkaround and to recover after a long and exciting day”
Reviews.Author: RalfIsa
Reviews.Content: We started our honeymoon in Singapore and looked for a hotel in the center at a reasonable price. We found the Grand Park City Hall and were really impressed by the staff`s friendlyness. Especially Jeannie from the reception was a wonderful and cheerful help and gave us a lot of interesting informations about the city and the people. A great help for newbies in Asia! The room, the breakfast and the overall service were great and we walked a lot in the area. The subway could be reached in 2 minutes, China town, Little India, the harbour and the famous Orchard Road could be easily reached by walking. The Asian Civilization Museum is a must!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and truely excellent service”
Reviews.Author: billy_bruce
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Park for 12 nights and i have to say it was truely excellent. From day 1 the staff were friendly, polite and genuinelly interested in making my stay a happy one and would happily go the extra mile to ensure you were happy. The food in the restuarant was excellent at all times, the buffet breakfast was amazing!!!! I stayed on the 9th floor and my room and views were great. There was easy access to the internet (free of charge) either via wifi or in the room. There is a club lounge on the 10th floor which i would recommend well worth the upgrade!! The Location is superb having been to singapore many times it is central and easily walkable to the usual attractions, raffles, boat quay, clarke quay, chjimes etc etc and there is the MRT link just a street away. I met one of the Managers a MR C.T Lim who was a thoroughly nice man and was extremely welcoming and to be honest ensured that our every need was catered for (thanks C T) all in all an excellent hotel in a great location well worth the money!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was nice to stay in the hotel”
Reviews.Author: David r
Reviews.Content: I like the room The break fast was lavely The club room was wonderfull especially Kasturi The Fitness center room was good I will recomendad this hootel to my company

Reviews.Title: “crystal club floor”
Reviews.Author: tonz_martin
Reviews.Content: A good place if youre on a business trip to singapore, the excutive suites serves its own title and the the lounge is just simply good especially with its cocktails and tit bits served daily. Highly recommended . The price is also resonable for the service provided.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay... central location...”
Reviews.Author: swets40205
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd time staying here and I would recommend the Grand Park City to anyone! Great hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and personable staff”
Reviews.Author: M S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 1 week on a business trip from London. The hotel is very centrally located close to St Andrew's Cathedral and Raffles City and within easy reach of the public transport network (bus and subway) which in Singapore is very efficient. Although the hotel is fairly large it doesn't feel that way. I stayed in the Chrystal Club rooms on the 9th floor and my room was of good size and was kitted out in a smart modern way (this is not a boutique hotel though). The rooms are spacious, clean and in good order. The staff were very friendly and always available to help. The pool area is nice but the pool isn't suitable for laps, only for 'splashing around'. The gym has adequate equipment to meet most people's needs and is kept clean.

Reviews.Title: “get a club room”
Reviews.Author: ktsue
Reviews.Content: excellant service nice friendly staff very relaxing. the first club room I was given was shabby however was immediately changed and upgraded when I requested another room - with no question. It would be good if they had a bar at the pool but there is a phone to call for service when needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: TimWhitfield
Reviews.Content: Located very centrally the Grand Park is well located near many major sights including Parliament building and the excellent Clarke Quay. From the moment you arrive there is an instantly welcoming feeling from the front of house staff and a modern, clean cut lobby. Stemming off are the bar with great entertainment each evening and the restaurant with a particularly good breakfast buffet! We were located in Club where the rooms were very well sized and modernly appointed. The views from most rooms seemed good and even mine on the supposed 'back side' was pleasant with a good view of the city. The fitness centre was well stocked with a good selection of modern equipment, while the pool was one of the real highlights. A nice oasis in the city with sharply designed pool and smart terraced area to while away a few hours! The most significant factor of our stay was however the excellent customer service received from all staff. The management team are particularly approachable and instill a very good attitude throughout their staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for money, friendly, professional service”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter_Aussie
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 nights in a Superior King room, but were upgraded on checkin with out even being asked or notified! Our room had plenty of space, and the bathroom had a separate shower. I'm not sure how much space the Supior King Room would have had, but the Manager did tell me it would not have had a separate shower. The bed and pillows were very comfortable, my only qualm being the bed did seem unusually short. My partner's feet hung over then end of the Queen bed, and he's not quite 5'11". I was told that the King beds in the hotel were only wider and not longer. The buffet breakfast had a great selection of both western and asian options, although getting a good coffee at the hotel was a bit of an issue. They also didn't have soy milk available for those among us who are lactose intolerant. There were a couple of issues with the room, however the manager and staff were eager to efficiently fix any problems. In fact every staff member we had contact with was friendly, polite and professional. The staff at the checkin desk speak excellent English and the Female Manager who assisted us several times was a credit to her hotel. The fitness centre has all the necessary equipment, however the air-conditioning didn't seem adequate for the environment. I visited the centre several times and there were never any staff on hand to assist with my request for cooling the room further. The Grand Park is in a great, central location for a first time or repeat trip to Singapore. Walking distance to Chijmes, Raffles city, Suntec City, Clarke and Boat Quays. A multitude of shopping and eating options at your fingertips. The City Hall MRT is just around the corner which links you to Orchard Road and everywhere else that you'd want to visit. Taxis are also cheap and plentiful if you don't fancy venturing out in the humidity. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: dks0311
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 9 days and it was a wonderful experience. Definitely recommend the Crystal Club level for your stay - the 10th floor social area which has breakfast, snacks, and a very robust happy hour with full range of cocktails. The staff for the entire hotel is gracious and exeptionally helpful. We will definitely stay here again in our next trip through Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Noel L
Reviews.Content: Staff very helpful and meet your business requirements to make your visit a success. Club froor facilities meet needs and internet in hotel and room fantastic. Good overall package, will return many times.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly room with insect sleeping with you!”
Reviews.Author: ckh287317
Reviews.Content: I went there with my family and stayed in Room 616 for 4 days. The room was small and the furniture was very old. The room was very smelly and the carpet was dirty. The curtain was also very dirty with stain. The bath tub was broken. On the second night, I found an insect on my arm when I was sleeping. The next morning, I checked the room again and subsequently found up to 7 insects crawling all over the curtains! I was really disappointed and all my family members also. We didn't expect a 5-star hotel like this!

Reviews.Title: “The worst 5-star hotel I ever experienced!”
Reviews.Author: Thho
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Room 619 for 3 nights in July end. The check-in staff (a pregnant woman) was rude and impolite. It seemed that I was in her PC. She only looked at her PC and never looked at me when she was talking to me! The room was far below the standard of 5-star. The furniture was old and broken. The carpet was dirty. There was stain on curtains that seemed not been washed for years. The basin cracked and the bath tub was broken. The shower was weak. The doors of the cabinet inside the bathroom was broken and there was dust all inside. They never clean or repair???? The only thing good about this hotel was one of their conceigere staff who had been very helpful and enthusiastic in searching location of a restaurant for me. Will you pay 5-star price for a 2-star hotel?? I won't! NEVER AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, bad location”
Reviews.Author: Dun8
Reviews.Content: Fairly tired hotel and no free Internet. Free parking though. Try others in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “OK room, KO internet connection..5 star???”
Reviews.Author: Wan_wf9485
Reviews.Content: Date: 7/31/2011 I booked this hotel since Swissotel the Stamford is fully booked on this period, and also the location is just nearby mrt station. My room was at the 10th floor, and Ive got no complain against the room except that this room and hotel is OLD.. Im here for a business trip, and I have to use internet for web meetings, I'm really dissapointed with the internet connection. It was very slow and reporting tho the IT department didnt help...and the IT guy didnt follow up on me after commited to do so.. plus, i called the housekeeping, they didnt turn up but after 3-4 hours waiting So, in term of service and internet connection----> IT WAS POOR

Reviews.Title: “I always come back here. This is my 3rd stay.”
Reviews.Author: subodh_awasthi
Reviews.Content: This place is quite close to many places. I dont know if i can say heart of the town, but yes for me this is it. As it saves a lot of my travelling time and in evening gives time to walk around boat quay, clarkquay etc. I mean its good and worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: SurreyDoris
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on a stopover back from Philippines. After a poor hotel in Boracay, Philippines (La Carmella) we couldn't wait to have a bit of luxury and we got it. The reception area is lovely, light and airy with a tropical garden area at the back. The staff were very friendly and polite and check in was easy. We had a twin room (I stayed with my mum). The room was a good size, very clean and bright. The ac was good. The bathroom had a bath with shower over. The location was good. I arranged a half day trip with Tour East who were very good with a good guide. The hotel was full of business people so no noise late at night. The bar in the hotel was nice with a female singer and male pianist in the evening. The breakfast was buffet style with a good selection. I would definitely like to go back to Singapore, so much to do and see and if I did, I would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Vastly improved service”
Reviews.Author: Harlow_Ashley123
