Reviews.Content: I returned to Grand Park City Hall after several years. Some previous stays had resulted in conflicts and I had been using different hotels. However, current staff was extremely friendly and efficient. The upper floor club has been upgraded and some of the rooms as well. Overall a pleasant stay largely due to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and its staff, but not its location so much”
Reviews.Author: leetonozzie
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the strength of its picture and website and the fact that it had a stay 4 pay 3 deal. We booked a delux room and we were not disappointed ! It is a lovely old building in great condition. I loved all the marble in the foyer and its modern indoor-outdoor lobby area. Our room was a twin and, to our dismay, was a connecting room. However, the view was nice, the a/c was very effective and the lighting facilities good. The bathroom had separate shower and bath facilities, so that we could both shower/bath at the same time! Cool! The pool on the 3rd floor was not just a token facility, but really lovely, and we made good use of it. The breakfasts catered to all tastes and ethnicities and was much enjoyed. The staff were very pleasant and helpful.Disadvantages: 1. we found the location not handy to anything, so had to find transport to almost everywhere as I had foot problems and couldnt walk far. Cabs were cheap and plentiful tho, and the MRT train system close by and exceptional. 2. I thought the shower tiles ever so slightly grungy . 3. The room's walls not especially sound proof. This was apparent when the room next door hosted a small but highly vocal gathering until late. We eventually called reception who dealt with it immediately and effectively. 4. Internet access was very difficult. All in all we had a very relaxed and happy stay at the GPCH and would consider booking again if in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “better than I thought”
Reviews.Author: r10623
Reviews.Content: I have read reviews before booking this hotel, and was a bit apprehensive, because of the not very nice reviews. But decided to book anyway, because it was 5*, downtown, and relatively value for money. It was better than I thought (but not spectacular), though my younger child thought otherwise. Good:- 1. We were allowed to check in earlier (2 pm) than stipulated time of 3 pm 2. Although we did not have connecting rooms, Bryan at reception kinda fall over backwards and made it happen the next day ... the downside is that we have to move all our stuff to one room the next day and check out one of the rooms (well, only the children, 11 and 16, that's why they were unhappy). 3. The concierges (day, afternoon, and night) were all very helpful and knowledgeable. Too bad I'd forgotten their names, I think one of them was Albert. 4. We were allowed late check-out for one of the rooms. We left at around 3:30 pm to go to the airport. Interesting:- 1. My spouse found the room musty, but I didn't notice anything. 2. Missing glass partition from bathroom shelf. 3. Broken door chain in children's room -- a bit of security concern, but thankfully Singapore is a safe place. 4. Decor (atrium) at breakfast location is interesting, a blend of east and west, old and new -- I believe the old and new wings were blended in. 5. Location was convenient -- a short walk to metro station, though at night, the "sex" signs come alive at nearby mall... OK:- 1. The breakfast service was good, selection not bad. Air-con place, no flies around. 2. The breakfast staff was very attentive -- e.g. a waitress dropped teapot (?), and immediately a few waiters rushed to help the client, and ensured he wasn't hurt by any shards, and helped moved him to sit in another location. Bad:- 1. (I didn't use nor see the pool, this was reported by husband and child.) The swimming pool was very small, like the size of a baby pool. 2. There were no towels available at the pool (later realized that towels were from fitness centre next to the pool).

Reviews.Title: “great location, good gym, but rather soulless”
Reviews.Author: brandenburg5
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 weeks in hotels in Singapore and spent a week here. We managed to get a pretty good deal online, though without breakfast or internet, both of which are pretty pricey. The two best features here are the gym, which is fairly large though unattended, and the location - very close to the MRT and to Raffles City which is a fantastic mall with lots of great places to eat. Chijmes, with its many bars and good restaurants, is also nearby. The digital mall in the next block also has some decent restaurants. The first room we were given had an awful mouldy smell. The porter said it was fresh paint but that was clearly not the case. It took some time for reception to give us another room but we were glad that they did as the second room did not smell. We were unimpressed with the staff at this hotel, who did not come across as helpful or even acknowledge us despite staying for an entire week. A couple more small points: the bathroom shelves were quite dusty, and the towels rather thin and stiff. Not really 5 star. We tried the hotel's Chinese restaurant one night and it was excellent and reasonably priced (hotel guests get 20% off).

Reviews.Title: “a relaxing holiday”
Reviews.Author: kenandyvonne
Reviews.Content: After 14 trips to Singapore, we feel that we should have some idea of what constitutes a good hotel. For the last 3 trips (2weeks each time), we have stayed at the Grand Park City Hall Hotel. Using the benefits of the gold card, we were able to stay in the clubrooms each time. The rooms have recently been refurbished and are well looked after. If you are considering staying more than a few nights you should explore this option. The hotel is reasonably located to many places of interest by walking. The Marina Bay complex is nearby and most nights we spent at least an hour quietly walking and enjoying the ambience. If this is not your scene, then the MRT is only 5 minutes away. The food & alcohol prices are reasonable by my Aust standards and get better after allowing for the exchange rate. There is plenty of variety to cater for most guests. Besides the obvious benefits, the most significant feature we have found with this hotel is the staff. We have always found them to be extremely helpful and friendly, from the cleaning staff to the front lobby staff. What more can I say , except in 2012 we are planning to go back to Singapore and we will be staying at the Grand Park City Hall Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Sitipurba
Reviews.Content: I have been working for the hotel industry for the last 15 years, I saw the rating of this hotel was 5 star, when we get there the reception area looks nice and hotel very central, I thought we will stay for 4 nights there,we arrive 9 am so we had to wait for 5 hours to get a room. At 2pm we got the twin bed room faced to the wall of next door building, the door was broken, the whole room was smell and damp, the bed was so old, sheets and the pillow cases smell like it hasn't been wash, the bathroom ceiling was mouldy, the sink didn't work properly. I couldn't believe that they actually rented this room out, we were so tired and I couldn't be bother complaining at the time. So I checked out the next day, the room cost 310 Singapore Dollar/ night without b/fast, had to pay 56 dollars for 2 b/fast and 12 dollars/hour to used the internet. What make me laugh was that they were doing this promotional for their 50th years anniversary and asking the guests to send their happy photos and good feedback so you could win a trip in one of their hotels around the world. When I check out I've told the receptionist about their room condition, and i heard there were another guest also had complained the same time i was there. We moved to the Fullerton Hotel and took their book two enjoy packaged, luxury hotel, we stay 2 nights in the heritage suite room, great buffet b/fast and free charge of internet during our stay, it cost me 560 Singapore Dollar for it all...fantastic deal! After all we had a great time in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Made my stay one of the best”
Reviews.Author: kevtheledge
Reviews.Content: Right from the time I stepped out of the cab in front of the hotel the staff, were amazingly helpful, I was fortunate to be staying as part of the Crystal Club and I’m not sure it's an extra part of the service but the staff especially Janette & Tiffany were amazing. The hotel is a little older than some in Singapore but it's not dated and old, the rooms are what you get in any hotel of this caliba, but extremely comfortable and roomy enough for me while on business. I would certainly recommend the Grand City Hall Hotel to anybody coming to stay in Singapore and I will be doing just that on my next visit. Regards, Kevin Todd

Reviews.Title: “Nice and affordable alternative.”
Reviews.Author: donroberto888
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers a fair price for the Deluxe room including club access and free internet. I happened to stay here due to a conference venue booking. It is an interesting alternative to the big and expensive hotels everzone knows.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly not bad”
Reviews.Author: trailblazer88
Reviews.Content: For a business hotel, Grand Park is very convenient if you need to stay near Raffles or Marina Bay. What I like about this hotel is that it is not too expensive compared with other hotels in the area and the internet is free. I would recommend this hotel if you need to find a cheaper place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to have leisures and Fun”
Reviews.Author: Lakbaypinay
Reviews.Content: The location is advantage of this hotel, it is located in the business center of the City, the staff as well are easy to ask request and to my demands they respond very well. We stay for two nights in this Hotel with my husband for business leisures, and to go somewhere around Singapore. every time we pass through the hall ways, to the lobby and to the restaurant and every place I went to, around the hotel is cleaned and fresh. this hotel offers tri-star service, but for me it offers me more than a tri-star treatment! I really enjoy my stay in this hotel, although I stayed for two days I encounter that nice thing. I'd always love to visit singapore and the Grand Park City Hall!

Reviews.Title: “will return in the future”
Reviews.Author: benney06
Reviews.Content: During our stay the service from all levels of staff , being from Reception , Concierge and every other dept were excellent , very polite and helpful. Walking distance to Clark Quay and Major shopping centers, shuttle bus provided to go to Orchard Ave.Drinks are expensive. Crystal Club is worth joining up , good value for money and especially Nikki from the club who makes it fun to be there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: AMRHoliday
Reviews.Content: Ideal location in City Hall area, close to City Hall MRT, Clark Quay & Boat Quay. Good Food and friendly staff, excellent value for money. Stayed 3 nights at Grand Park City Hall but could have stayed longer. We were always late for breakfast, but the staff made sure we never went hungry....

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Good Location, Average Service”
Reviews.Author: rwintour
Reviews.Content: It was my second time staying at this hotel after years back for the 1st one. I like the location of this hotel in the area of city hall and near to the Raffles City. Very convenient as well to walk to reach Clark Quay in the evening. And other interests in the surroundings are peranakan museum, bible house, Armenian Church and others which located in the green neighbourhood. The check in was smooth, with good acceptance from the front desk staff and my reservation was upgraded to be on the club floor. The room was clean but quite modest for a club floor room; seems to be in deluxe category, but I had no problem since the room and bathroom were clean. The furniture looked bit run down but overall still tolerable. The breakfast quite okay, with lots of varieties of bfast dishes. Pity they dont provide the crispy bacon again as they used to.But seem the staff in the coffee shop too busy and no smile or welcome greet addressed to us. Seems so Jaded, well very Singaporean, simple, easy and straight to the point D. This also seems to happen to the staff at the lobby except one lady that greeted us on the last day when we were rushing getting into the Chrysler taxi, she was very nice and cheerful (forgot the name). So overall, this hotel provides good service and accommodation; the improvement shall be done soon to the interior of the room and staff attitude to be more servicing. Hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wastage of your Money . No Service . Just Sleep”
Reviews.Author: INDIAOUTSOURCES
Reviews.Content: Grand Park , City Hall has only one advantage , you get Indian Food around , if you are Indian . Else trust me even the Conceirge service is very Poor . I really do not know early check in was not allowed . Any how flight from Delhi - Singapore reaches at 8 :00 am so it was first very tough. You need to get yourself fresh up Funny it was but true that they send me to swimming pool area third floor , No body was there to Guide me to shower . It was worst if you go in before 2 :00 PM to them , they would simply not entertain Staff very RUDE , atleast the Concierge Guy . They have this small candle being lit and suddenly it got fire . I was sitting nearby and this guy instead of asking if everything ok , asked me 'Did you do anything' I said , do you think I would have done it and this is the way you speak your customer. He said 'its better to ask' Sick . Atlast finally I got a room at 12:45 PM , and that was not my choice , but whatever available with them Pathetic its not 4 star at all . No Cofee maker , No Morning tea , and I do not know if the Breakfast was included at all, She did not even informed anything about the package . Nothing was available So I would rate this as a real Poor Hotel . Old Hotel with no Charm , Lot of recovery and re-innovation is required .

Reviews.Title: “Great service , good food, excellent conceirge”
Reviews.Author: aussieivan
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 6.00am and was very tired. We were let into our room even though we hadn't booked for the night before. Wife asked if we could get a cup if coffee anywhere and to our surprise we were asked to sit in the lobby and a waitress brought us a cup of coffee each. Then we were shown to our rooms, we even got a free upgrade to the club floor. We found the breakfast to be good and they even had a honeycomb leaking fresh honey into a dish, very cute. The evening buffet was fantastic and good value for money. Drinks with the meal were reasonable but having drinks in the bar and deli were expensive. $7.00 for a coffee is too much. Gym was well appointed and the pool was fine but could be improved on. The rooms we had were also fine with large beds and nice bathrooms. We found all staff to be helpful especially the concierge team. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “just-right location close to gate 4 of the singapore gp”
Reviews.Author: tommysudarsono
Reviews.Content: stayed at the grand park city hall last year due to its closeness to gate 4 of the singapore gp, 2-3mins walking distance. extremely convenient if you have the padang grandstand tickets. in overall a wonderfull experience, reception & concierge were fast and efficient, breakfast buffet was OK. one improvement probably is the cleanliness of the room, i am very sensitive and a bit allergic to dust, and the room we stayed in was not dust free with a bit of cigarrette scent (we ordered a non smoking room though).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Shell11j
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel on a three week tour of SE Asia. The main entrance is impressive, but the service at check in was slow. We had booked a superior king room but were told there wasn't one available so we were given a twin. Disappointing. The rooms are very musty (as mentioned in many other reviews). You really cant avoid the damp smell but do get used to it. I think its mainly because the bathrooms need to be refurbished as its the tiles and shower curtains that are causing the problem in my opinion. The room was a decent size with a very comfortable bed. We slept very well here! There's nothing special about the rooms, but they served as a great base for exploring Singapore so I would stay here again for this purpose. We had breakfast at the deli which was pretty good and room service for breakfast twice which was good value for money but basic food. Didn't eat in the hotel restaurant at night as Singapore has amazing places to eat (especially in China Town!). I'd definitely recommend the night market.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service, poor room”
Reviews.Author: simoncollier1961
Reviews.Content: Typical attentive service for a Singapore hotel, but the rooms need a complete refurb'. My room was overwhelmingly musty in odour; I put up with it for a couple of nights, but won't stay there again unless they refresh them.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice and ideally located for exploring”
Reviews.Author: HelenC53
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff throughout the stay, especially those manning reception and concierge areas. Great ambience with attentive service. Buffet restaurant gave good choices - especially liked the local dishes, deli good for a quick option and breakfast alternative. Reasonably priced considering Singapore prices. Room had work area, relaxed seating (for one) and large bed - clean and tidy. A five minute walk to Clarke Quay, with MRT stations at Clarke Quay and City Hall also approx. five minutes away. Not much further to Raffles/Raffles City/Chinatown. Would want to return to this hotel if we were in Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service - High Standard”
Reviews.Author: ElvisGannon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very centrally located and one is able to walk to a number of tourist resorts very easily. My stay here has been very pleasant and the hotel staff and managers have been very supportive in assisting me organise my programme at this hotel. As a business traveller it has been convenient for me to organise a training programme using the conference facilities at this hotel. Suggest that you opt for staying at the Club Floor where you have the option of using the Club Lounge. The staff at the Club Lounge are excellent in service delivery and very helpful. There are fairly good eateries and shopping mall closely by. Also, for Night life there is Chimes and Boat and Clark Quay. Raffles Hotel is about a ten minute walk away and a delight to visit. For those of you wishing to visit Singapore on business or pleasure suggest this will be a good location to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and helpful staff and Crystal Club adds to the experience.”
Reviews.Author: vk0036
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 nights and were Crytsal Club guests. Staff were exceptionally helpful and and friendly and nothing seemed too much trouble for any of them to make our stay more enjoyable - especially Nikki at Crystal Club and Bob, the wonderful Concierge in the foyer of the hotel. Our room was spacious, clean and serviced daily. We had a partial view of the pool obstructed by other buildings. Sometimes there was a bed turndown service provided and other times it wasn't done (minor detail). The bed was larger than king size and very comfortable. Bathroom was cleaned to a good standard. Amenities were good too. Laundry service was reliable, Gym was well equipped - I didn't realise there was a sauna. There was no staff to provide advice on how to use the gym equipment properly. Pool area was cleaned daily. Pool is older style and water could be a little cooler (especially since the climate is so warm). The glazed tiles in pool are slippery so caution must be taken. Bar on ground (1st floor) provided entertainment nightly. We never used the restaurant for meals but did have happy hour at the Crystal Cub nearly every night before dinner. I liked that the hotel was not too big and has an old world but "regal"charm about it. Overall it was a lovely experience due to the staff. My only negative comment is regarding the gym - no one there to help you with the machines.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, with anxious staff, and gourmet breakfast”
Reviews.Author: R0thFamily
Reviews.Content: I was at the hotel for a week. The staff is anxious, the laundry was so bad that I used it only once. The breakfast is too gourmet, and almost have nothing to eat. The receptionist was the most anxious woman that I met at a hotel. The tub was a little dirty. The location is great very close to Raffles Hotel (5 min), and the hotel is not so cheap. There are better hotels at Syngapore!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need refurbishing, use to be our favourite hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ted1037
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times and always loved it but the room we had this time was worn and tired and badly in need of refurbishment. The entrance is still elegant, the staff are great and the restaurant and bar are still excellent. It is now overpriced for the room standard. The pool area requires an upgrade; the fountains don't work and the pavers are eneven and broken. There are not enough loungers and umbrellas.

Reviews.Title: “First class concierge service”
Reviews.Author: redkerr15
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent area, easy to walk to the underground, Raffles and down by the river. The lobby is very nice, the rooms were okay with the corridors a bit shabby. Would not put this hotel in the luxury bracket but definitely good value mid-range. Found the rooms to be very clean. Breakfast was fabulous. Best bit about the hotel was Sadi the wonderful concierge who recommended the wonderful Stellar to us. Also got us checked in pre flight. Couldn't do enough for us!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: marnie_g2001
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 5 nights with our daughter and son in law & baby in 2 rooms. Brilliant rate with full buffet breakfast and taxes included. We arrived at 4am on the first night. We had requested 2 rooms on the same floor one with a cot. (The hotel does not promise a cot but a request can be made) When we arrived at the hotel at 4am it was fully booked we were told - the 2 rooms on the same floor were not available and no cot was available until 7am. So we had a king bed room on the 6th floor, neat, clean, comfortable and compact with a stained carpet a long way from the lifts and our daughter, son in law and baby who shared a king bed in a room on the club floor. The cot arrived the next morning as promised. Next morning we stopped at the reservation desk and requested a room on the same floor as our daughter if possible before heading for the breakfast buffet. We were contacted just after breakfast and the hotel staff had moved our luggage to the ninth floor and our room was slightly larger than the one on the 6th floor with a superb view of the new "Sands Hotel Complex" particularly at night when it is fully lit and few rooms down from our daughter. Perfect. We enjoyed the buffet breakfast, There was a pretty good selection and the staff were wonderful with the baby making sure she was strapped into her high chair properly each morning. The hotel is in a superb location, It is a four star tourist class hotel with 5 star friendly staff who try very hard to please their hotel guests. Most evenings there is a resident pianist and female vocalist in the cocktail bar which is very pleasant. The hotel has a nice pool and a large heated spa which we enjoyed late in the afternoons. As a family we had a good stay. The hotel and rooms overall are a little dated however very comfortable. I am sure that if the hotel undergoes a facelift you will be paying quite a lot more for the rooms. My husband and I if staying on our own would go a little more upmarket in our hotel selection.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I think I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: cantwaituntilnexthol
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms look nice it would have to be the worst hotel we’ve ever stayed in. Definitely not a 5 star in terms of quality. Even a 4 star is a bit of a stretch. We had to change rooms because of mould, a really putrid smell & flooding in the bathroom. One of my colleagues has had to change rooms twice, due to the smell. We were apparently 'upgraded' but the room is exaclty the same - just a couple of levels higher. Our current room doesn’t smell as bad as the first room, but still not that nice. I think I've owrked out why it smelss so bad. I don't think they use cleaning products & the smell is from bacteria in the toilet. Although it looks clean it obviously isn't. We told the valet, when he asked, that we would like a taxi to take us to Holland Village. The valet spoke to the taxi driver in Chinese & we hopped in. We knew something was wrong as soon as we got out of the taxi. I checked out our location with GoogleMaps on my iPhone & sure enough the taxi had dropped us in Little India. My husband ordered an espresso from the waiter whilst at breakfast. After waiting 30 mins he enquired after it. Apparently they sent it to our room. When he tried to explain that he is obviously not in the room & tried to cancel the order, the staff insisted that it was on its way & they gave him a filtered coffee with milk (which is what they offer as included in the breakfast buffet) & still charged for the Espresso. He was in such a hurry & so flustered by it all he had to sign for it just to get away from there. By the way – I was in the room; the espresso never arrived. After a quick swim to cool off we discovered there was no pool towels left. So I rang from the pool/gym phone to ask if someone could restock the pool towels. They wanted to send some pool towels to the room. I tried to explain that I was already at the pool & there were more guests requiring towels. 45 mins later, towels still hadn’t arrived. The internet connection is abysmal. It is like old school dial-up. The mattress on the bed is so hard, one would swear they were lying on the floor. My back is killing me. Workmen entered our room without knocking or ringing the doorbell. Luckily I was sitting at the desk, working. I could go on & on… even more than I appear to have. It has become quite comical. Needless to say if we were paying ourselves, we would’ve checked out & moved to another hotel. The location is good & the food at their breakfast & lunch buffets are fantastic, so at least they have one thing right.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel. *** at best”
Reviews.Author: molloyk
Reviews.Content: The governing body for awarding stars needs to review this rating No way is this hotel a 5 star, at very best a 3. (regardless of facilities) Externally the hotel looks OK. Its in a good location too. Lobby seemed OK , check-in was basic. I booked a superior room in this hotel for a two night stay. I was given a room on the 7th floor. Based on the following experience i did not investigate the pool or gym and definitely did not visit the restaurants for breakfast or any other meals My suspicions about the sub-standard quality of the hotel were first aroused while walking the corridor to the room. Getting out of the lift i was greeted buy a pungent , damp musty smell, not a humid country hotel smell. Carpets were shabby and dirty, walls and room doors were seriously degraded. I entered my room to find black mold on fittings , paint falling off the walls , mildew growing an all the walls.Carpet was filthy. Bathroom quality and cleanliness was also highly questionable. I went to reception to complain and was told this room was scheduled for renovation so i got upgraded to a deluxe room on the same floor. But it was highlighted this room was much bigger and i should be charged more, but this time would be charged.I thought this was OK, but also thought they had a cheek giving me the room in the first place. I got to my new room expecting some improvement. The difference was wallpaper covering the walls and had cheap ikea style furniture, the room was not much bigger than the previous . This room was equally as bad apart from the walls(wallpaper covering the mildew perhaps). Dirty bathroom , pubic hair in the sink. Cheap towels. again the presence of black mold and the carpet looked like it hadn't been hovered in a very long time. As my stay was brief , i decided to grin and bare it. Staying outside the hotel for as long as possible. Arriving to sleep only and shower. Perhaps every other floor is reasonable, perhaps i drew the short straw in room allocation. Conclusion: I would happily NOT recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Four Star not Five”
Reviews.Author: PegususPerth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good four star hotel but certainly doesn't rate as a five star. We stayed here for four nights at the end of February and got a really good deal of $175AUD for a superior Club Room. This included club access with breakfast and early evening drinks and snacks. This is the first hotel we have come across that would not allow us to choose to have breakfast in their cafe or the club lounge and therefore were stuck with having breakfast in the club lounge. This was such a dismal affair. They know how many people are staying in their club rooms and would be having breakfast in the club lounge but they were so unprepared every morning of our stay, even though we went there at different times. The choice is very limited to start with but a lot of the dishes were empty and didn't get replaced. They did not replenish the food regularly but also plates, cups and crockery would run out. It really was a hit and miss affair. The snacks at early evening were excellant, the quality was first class. Even though there was not a big choice what they did have couldn't have been better, both in freshness and quality. The chef deserves congratulations. The foyer is lovely but does not carry through to the rest of the hotel, particularly the rooms. The pool spa is very nice and the gym is large. The hotel is in a very good location and the rooms are a decent size, although a bit dated.. The views are not good at all, even though we were on a higher floor. One of the guys at the entrance was very nice and over our stay his welcome greetings became so genuine, along with his smile. I didn't get his name but it made our experience that little bit special. If it wasn't for the cheap rates I would not bother to stay here again, mainly because of the lack of good views.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: BenandJo
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location - friendly staff, quality hotel. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Good Mid-range hotel”
Reviews.Author: Denise07012
Reviews.Content: Corner Deluxe room on 6th floor for 5 nights. Booked on Qantas website & got upgrade from Superior to Deluxe and 4pm check-out for Aust$164 (Feb, 2011). Positives: Good location, 5-10mins walk from City Hall MRT Station Large room with bath and shower, & walk-in closet/suitcase storage alcove Bed large and very comfortable Huge TV - lots of channels Reception staff efficient and helpful. Very quiet room Efficient housekeeping staff - room extremely clean Deli and Room service food - good quality Negatives: Traditional 1980s fittings and bathroom Scuffed walls Stained carpet Room safe not large enough for Laptop

Reviews.Title: “Could be better for the price.”
Reviews.Author: TerryEmu
Reviews.Content: The location is great, the room was good ( for Singapore ). I just thought that for the price paid you could have been supplied with a bottle of water, and not have to pay $28 a day for the internet. Also breakfast was not included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Cost's the earth and the rooms are tiny”
Reviews.Author: DiBusso
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a gorgeous room when I opened the door to my room, First thing I noticed was the stained carpet, the room was very small, the only part of the room that was very nice was the bathrooom. Renovations are happening at the hotel as well so there was some noise and disruption. I would not recommend this hotel at the price i was chaged which was just over $300.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Decent Food - Tired Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Wozza2404
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides an ideal base for anyone who needs to get to Suntec every day, but doesn't want to pay the premium to stay somewhere like the Mandarin. Walkable to the exhibition centre throught the air conditioned mall, and set amongst the traditional architecture of City Hall. The hotel itself is decent enough. The lobby looks suitably impressive (as it should in a £120+ hotel), but the rooms are a little tired and are starting to border on 'shabby'. Staff are helpful and friendly (as they invariably always are in Singapore). I was sent to the 'Club Floor' when I arrived, where they managed to convince me to part with an extra £25 per night to have free internet, breakfast, laundry and pre-dinner drinks... Turns out it was a really good thing, but it was still a bit of a hard sell which you could do without after 16 hours of travelling. All in all a great hotel for business, but I probably wouldn't stay here with my family (although that choice would come down to location rather than any other factor).

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel, very conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: AzimuthalP
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week at their exclusive Crystal Club Floor. Room was spacious with all modern amenities and facilities. Club wing had a free internet with a decent speed. I could make VoIP calls. Check-in was smooth and was done exclusively at the Club floor. Room service was good but with very limited options, laundry service was average. Bathroom and bath accessories were average, expected them to be a little better especially in premium rooms. Hotel main lobby was really grand and had a shopping arcade. The best part of the hotel though was its location. Located right in the heart of main business and shopping district. It was a walking distance from Raffles, several other malls and Esplanade area. Taxis were also readily available from right outside the hotel almost all 24 hours and hotel is a stone's through from the City Hall MRT station. Had regular meals at Indulge At Park during lunch buffet, the spread was good and had variety and selections from various cuisines. Breakfast served at Crystal Floor although gives an exclusive feel but has a repetitive menu but a good lounge area and premium condiments. Hotel also serves free drinks/canapes in the evening and snacks/tea/coffee all day long in the Crystal Club.

Reviews.Title: “Nestled in an ideal location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Foxtel
Reviews.Content: Was given great service by friendly hotel staff. Check in was swift with very little hassle. I stayed in a club room on the top floor, which offered complimentary breakfast and evening cocktails. The room was very cozy and clean, but some of the furniture was a bit worn. Nevertheless I'd consider the room 4 star, with 5 star hotel service. Room comes with complimentary wired internet access with a laptop, but unfortunately I didn't bring mine with me. Location is what makes this hotel an ideal stay. It's located in the Civic district of Singapore, central to everything and within walking distance of MRT. You can shop at Raffles Central, with Suntec city and Millienia Square nearby, or take a train to Orchard for more shopping there. There are about 5-6 hawker centres within 5 minute walk, so local food options are almost endless if you want to try the local food. Also Funan is across the road (6 storey technology shopping mall), and peninsula plaza next to it for more cheap traditional shopping. Hotel also contains a SPA park, where I received a splendid facial for a modest price. The service there was second to none and I'd go again next time I holiday here.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for exploring Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Kim-Phil
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights at the start of our trip over Christmas and 1 night at the end of our trip in January. The location is very central and ideal for sight seeing. We walked a lot and also caught the MRT and a bus to the botanical gardens and to Changi museum. The MRT is close by. A taxi takes about 20-25 mins from the airport. Our superior room was on the 6th floor for the 3 nights and then on the 9th for the last night which is the club floor. There was no difference in the rooms other than a dvd player was in the 9th floor room. The bathroom is tiny but was clean. We didnt use the pool or the fitness room although they both looked fine. The bed was comfortable. Tea and coffee was supplied in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the crowd, nestled in quiet freshness”
Reviews.Author: gdbhinge
Reviews.Content: Grand Park City Hall has a strategic location which is near to Airport. Boat quay and Clark quay are 5 min walking distance. Orchard st & Little India are 10 min by taxi. There are ample restaurants around however it misses hustle bustle of Orchard street. Breakfast is average. Superior rooms are little smaller than expected. Cleanliness and room service is good. Wired internet is free and available 24 hours. Overall it is god experience.

Reviews.Title: “not a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: bauer2488
Reviews.Content: Grand Park City Hall is definitely NOT a 5 star hotel as it claims to be in the website. I was disappointed at first after looking at my room that it is only at level the most 3 stars. My room has poor lighting system with an emergercy light like hanging on the wall. The advantage of this hotel is it is near City Hall MRT and accessible to all. Get this hotel at bargain price only good for 3 star

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place to stay for Business travelers”
Reviews.Author: phoenixblr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for well over 15 days in the month of July. Its location on 10 Coleman street was very ideal for me as it was close to my workplace, literally just a 10 min walk. There are restaurants for various cuisines around, the restaurant in the hotel itself is multi cuisine and they had live music which was just the thing i needed after a long day at work to relax and get geared up for the next day. There are three bus stands near by, which was really helpful for my commute to various places. there is a mall right opposite and behind the hotel catering to one's needs with respect to apparels, electronics, cameras and accessories etc. It is kind of a landmark as all the people at work as well as my friends there knew where this was so it was easy for them to drop by. I came to the room one day and saw a fruit basket on the table with a note expressing there gratitude that I chose to stay at their hotel, this was really lovely, the staff as such are very helpful and some of them are multi lingual which is an added advantage. Overall a wonderful place to stay for a Business traveler, again I say for a Business traveler as it would otherwise been a hit on my pocket as I am a middle of the road kind of a traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: hozaifa
Reviews.Content: Grand Park is a very nice n centrally located hotel in Singapore. Being an electronic freek n a food lover staying at central park was a fun stay altogether. Theelectronic mall "Funan" is just across the road and Clark Quay is a 5 mins walk from the hotel. The wide spread of variety of breakfast spread is sure to make the start of your daY WONDERFUL N DELICIOUS. A very warm welcoming staff make you feel very homely and they are very co-operative too.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like a superstar”
Reviews.Author: Guru14
Reviews.Content: The grand Park City Hall Singapore has been our choice of Hotel in Singapore several times now.Located within easy reach of the MRT, Chinatown and Clarke Quay. The concierges make one feel like a superstar and nothing is too much trouble, I have even ben taken to a restaurant close by the Hotel personally and introduced to a wonderful Indian breakfast.The rooms are great and the "Bar on Coleman" is a fantastic place to relax after a busy day, have a beer or latte to unwind. I reccomend this hotel and its fabulous staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, near food center and subway”
Reviews.Author: hktinter
Reviews.Content: Good location, only 2 station of subway to Orchard, Hotel locate near food center and 7 Eleven

Reviews.Title: “Aging but sufficient, central location”
Reviews.Author: Mir0K
Reviews.Content: Booked based on a discounted rate available and TripAdvisor reviews. Rooms alright, although the age is showing. The usual smell associated with hotels in humid climate countries. Location very central, a 5-10 minute walk to the Esplanade and Raffles city. Two malls directly adjacent. Service was good, housekeeping prompt. Concierge could use some improvement, cannot be relied on with calling taxis which are rather difficult to get in Singapore. I was late for a meeting despite ordering a taxi the previous day and giving the destination address (no traffic jams). Was a good deal because of the discount, not sure if the usual rates make it worthwhile

Reviews.Title: “Top Place, Top Spot”
Reviews.Author: kimberlyjane_10
Reviews.Content: Read many reviews when making my decision on where to stay, and it paid off. From the moment we arrived to time we left we couldn't fault anything. All staff were friendly and courtious, breakfast was lovely (included in price) that was another reason for picking this place as well as the location,as its not that easy to find in Singapore. We could walk anywhere, it was so close to many sightseeing attractions. Also tried out the transport sysyem....amazingly easy, specially for people that don't have a clue on any public transport.... and cheap. Love singapore!

Reviews.Title: “No frills on a good location”
Reviews.Author: LucyLu007
Reviews.Content: I recently travelled to Singapore and ended up to the Grand Hall City Park as booking late on a busy weekend, the rest was either sold out or too expensive. I had a corporate rate, and must say it was good value for money, given the quite central location. The service was good and the hotel staff very friendly. On the negative side, the hotel is a bit outdated and lacking style. I got a room close to the elevator, which turned out to be very noisy, and got waken up in the middle of the night by people spekaing loud (isolation is really bad, and that is the main reason why i would not recommend this hotel). Also breakfast was disappointing with very limited choices and no fresh fruit apart from apples and bananas. There is a pool, which is ok, but very very small. Perhaps a better room would make me change my opinion, but still it was lacking style and personality.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were disgusting”
Reviews.Author: BizTravel1218
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I were traveling through Asia and had 4 nights in Singapore. Grand Park City Hotel apparently is a preferred location for my firm. Check in was uneventlful. The action started when I opened the door to my room. The smell of dampness / mildew / mold was unbelievable. The carpet was wet from the amount of moisture in the air, as was the bed spread. Because I am paranoid about bed bugs, I checked the bed and curtains. No bedbugs - but I was completely disgusted when I saw mold all over the curtains as well as certain areas along the floorboards. My colleagues and I met for a drink and had similar stories, so changing rooms would likely not solve the problem. So we toughed it out. The next morning, each of us were completely congested and had headaches. This was the mold. We decided to change to a different hotel (Marina Mandarin - excellent). When I went to the closet to take clothes off of hangers, they were wet with moisture. I know this is Singapore and it is hot and humid.... but this was unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable, well situated hotel with teriffic staff”
Reviews.Author: JohnR103808
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be situated in an excellent position for walking to the Singapore River resturants and attractions and other sites (eg.China Town)on this side of the city. The hotel was clean and comfortable with the most friendly and helpful staff. Of particular mention would be the Concierge team who provided terrific assistance through advice, suggestions and support whenever we placed a request to them. This was particularly helpful to us as we planned, as far as possible, to manage our own sightseeing and travelling over the four day there. More than just service they provided friendliness.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in a great location with very helpfull, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: PhilSouthAustralia
Reviews.Content: Stayed seven nights in two rooms, one for my wife and I, and the second down the passage for our two adult sons.The rooms were very comfortable and clean with very good bathrooms. the only negative was a damp musty smell that disapeared after two to three days of our stay. The location was great, close to MRT, a short walk to Clarke Quay, Orchard Rd, Chinatown, Raffles City, Suntec etc. The staff are very friendly, helpfull and had a great knowledge of Singapore its history, where to go, and how to get there. Nothing we asked was to much trouble for them. The pool area as a bit small so not many people could us it at once. Standard buffet breakfast was good but a bit expensive. There are plenty of other options nearby. All things considered we all had a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect the earth and you wont be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: keenshopper
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this hotel a couple of days before Youth Olympic Games (YOG) were due to start.The hotel was very busy and the staff in the dining room for breakfast were completely overwhelmed and couldn't cope. As the hotel emptied later that week things got better but not much. Stayed at this hotel on several occasions over the last few years and though it isn't the best in it's price range it makes up with position and the food is generally good. I am already planning my holiday for next year and if we decide to travel through Singapore then we shall certainly stay here again for a few days, but we will not expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “not quite as promised...”
Reviews.Author: ACox199
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Singapore with friends to meet up with husbands so I ended up staying in two different types of rooms at the Grand Park City Hall- the superior and deluxe. Our plane landed late so we were not able to check in until around 1am. The staff was great, and completely accommodated our late arrival. For the second night I switched to a deluxe room. Since I had stayed in the hotel with friends the previous night I asked for an early check in the following morning. Again, the staff was wonderful and let me check in around 10am. However, when I arrived in the room I was slightly disappointed. Yes, the deluxe had much more space than the superior room, and the bathroom layout was improved, but the view was TERRIBLE. On the hotel site they say some of the deluxe rooms have a view of Fort Canning, so I was expecting somewhat of a view even if it wasn't Fort Canning. Instead I got to look at the corner of the building and a parking garage the entire trip. On top of that, we also had an ant problem in our room. In a matter of 5 minutes I had killed 10 ants and they kept coming back day after day. I was also not a fan of the bed, but I prefer soft plush beds rather than a more firm mattresses. In both the superior and deluxe rooms, there were king beds that were more like a California King. The first night with friends, we slept 3 girls very comfortably in the bed. On a more positive note, this hotel is in a GREAT location. It is very centrally located- about 10 minutes walking to bars in Clark Quay, 20 minutes walking to the marina area, and 5 minutes or less to the MRT. If I were traveling back to Singapore, I would not be adverse to staying in this hotel, but I would look for other options first. Pros: good location, great staff, huge king size bed Cons: firm bed, ant issue, lacking view, unexpected tax charges on final bill (most other places included the tax when giving an estimate.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lowa88
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, walkable to attractions (Merlion, Kampong Glam), near MRT and RafflesCity with a great foodcourt. Breakfast was excellent with Western and Asian choices (Chinese, Indian). Room is clean, and pleasant, bathroom a little small. Cost Singapore$ 16 from Changi Airport to Hotel in early afternoon (20 min).

Reviews.Title: “A very average hotel in an excellent location...”
Reviews.Author: LKG2008
Reviews.Content: Singapore was our final stop of our honeymoon. Our travel agent had secured a room upgrade with flowers and fruit on arrival. However, when we were greeted by the unfriendly receptionist, there was no mention of our honeymoon offers. Having stayed at the Traders Hotel in Kuala Lumpur and experiencing excellent service, it highlighted how poor The Grand Park City Hall was. Breakfast was poorly organised with miserable and unhelpful staff. The room was very small as mentioned on previous reviews. There was no free internet access or wireless connection. On the positives - the location is great for the MRT which is a highly efficient and cheap way of getting around Singapore. The concierge were helpful (the only people in the building it seems!) We would not recommend for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Give these rip off merchants a wide berth”
Reviews.Author: MaudBucks
Reviews.Content: We were delayed due to the air traffic disruption due to volcanic activity in Iceland and had to lay over in Singapore. The ever fabulous Trailfinders found us a random hotel at short notice (The Grand Park City Hall). However the pokey room (allegedly a deluxe) had barely room for us to pass eachother once the 'put you up' had been installed for our six year old son and smelt of damp, with black bacteria growing on the old sealant around the dated bathroom fittings (no one fancied getting in the bath). Allegedly there were no spare rooms to swap into. After two nights, we extended our stay ourselves... however, unknowingly, the hotel charged us DOUBLE per night than the rate Trailfinders had secured for us. When we queried this later, albeit after check out, they did not budge. They also charged us for a breakfast we didn't have on the last day, despite us checking out BEFORE breakfast had opened to guests for that morning. We queried this standing in front of them at reception, but as they had already printed off the bill, they said would not remove the charge. Unbelievable. Location wise, it's a hot walk to the nearest underground through a smelly car park (you are better off staying in a hotel attached to an airconditioned mall in SIngapore. The gym is good and the pool, though dated and in need of refurb was popular with our son due to the shallow end being 80cm and he isn't that confident a swimmer yet. Too few sunbeds though, and no food and beverage around the pool, so rather grim. Service a bit slow all round. Overall the hotel is terribly dated and grubby in places, best to give it a wide berth. Otherwise the SIngaporeans were lovely people!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kaavya
Reviews.Content: Grand Park City Hall is a very nice place to stay if you are visiting Singapore. It is situated at the centre of the city & very close to the MRT. If someone is touring & wants to explore the city, then this is the best place to be. Singapore Flyer is just 15 min walkable distance from this hotel. Riverwalk is also just 5 minutes away. The Clake Quay is also close to the hotel. The room is not very big but good enough. Internet is not free. The quality of picture on the television is not very great. But there is a spa & other service is good.

Reviews.Title: “Very fancy lobby!”
Reviews.Author: cavamebri
Reviews.Content: Everything was great - managed to get us an adjoining room which was handy as we were travelling with 6 of us. Pool was nice - bit on the small side and food was a bit expensive, but there are plenty of options close by for eating

Reviews.Title: “Botched up reservation left me homeless!”
Reviews.Author: ckblah
Reviews.Content: It's pathetic. I reserved on the 9th of August online for Aug 14th which resulted in me booking for the 9th of August! Which is ridiculous to begin with. Furthermore, I selected the weekend package! The reservation went through without a hitch! It was only on the 9th night that I realised something was wrong and gave them a call. They assured me everything was fine. However, they then emailed me on the 10th that they cancelled my booking for the 14th, seriously, have the decency to call!

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service from staff, great food, great location. I would go back.”
Reviews.Author: Aussietraveller035
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located near the MRT, shops and some food halls. We arrived late in the evening. Check-in was speedy, receptionist was friendly and funny at the time of night we arrived. The concierge staff was also friendly and helpful. The hotel is clean, has a great restaurant the nightly singers were enjoyable to hear. Depending on how much space you need, my mother and I shared a deluxe twin room which had 2 x king single beds, massive bathroom and flat screen tv and enough amenities for us to use. I wouldn't complain about the room size or what it offered. I didn't see the superior room, and given that Singapore accommodation is generally more expensive than the other south east asian countries, the deluxe room was worth the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel! Wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Steph_Australia_85
Reviews.Content: Room was 5 star, pool and Gym were great, Staff were friendly. We arrived in Singapore at 6am, when we got to the hotel, we expect not to be able to check in till 2pm, but staff did their best and we were in our room by 9.30am. We wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “If you like sleeping on a rock hard bed, this is the place for you!”
Reviews.Author: chelsette
Reviews.Content: We booked into this hotel on our singapore stopover on the way home from Kohsamui. We had originally booked into a crystal club room, and when we checked in we were told we had been upgraded to the governors suite. We were so excited, and upon opening our room were so much more excited. There was an outdoor jacuzzi, 2 toilets, a spa in the enormous ensuite, a massive kingsized bed...... but unfortunately loos can be deceiving, and if we had paid full price for the suite we wouldhave demanded our money back. After a late check in we were looking forward to a great nights sleep, but when we went to bed the mattress was ROCK hard. And I mean rock hard! It felt like we were sleeping on the floor I have never ever slept on a mattress like that. We complained about it the following day, but after the following night I doubt they could even do anything about it. The we decided to go outside and make the most of our jacuzzi. Well what a waste of time, it was green with algae, and when we asked i it could be cleaned we were told it was out of order. So not to be disappointed we decided to fill the spa up and enjoy hat, only to find that the spa was alos out of order! So the upgrade was an absolute let down. Overall the resort is in need of some major renovations. I am sure this suite would have been fantastic 20 years ago, but it felt like a badly renovated house. The carpet was worn out and dirty, the bathroom was damp and mouldy, with cracks all through the tiles, some tiles missing. The outdoor area was a waste of time. I certainly would not stay here again, there a heaps of other resorts in the immediate area that look much better.

Reviews.Title: “All satisfy , except their speed...”
Reviews.Author: Leesl
Reviews.Content: Not Good - we waited at least 45 mins to check in - Room not yet clean up yet .... unclean teacups in our room Good - Staffs were friendly and helpful - Nice location - Breakfast tasty!!

Reviews.Title: “Great after the upgrade.”
Reviews.Author: retdtraveller
Reviews.Content: Were allocated a Superior room that was musty smelling with damp on the wall and a very tired look to it - stains on teh carpet and 3 areas of damage in the bath. After complaining were upgraded to a higher level. The room here was totally satisfactory (as had teh one we had stayed in a month earlier) and the staff throughout were helpful and pleasant. Would recommend only Executive roms and above!

Reviews.Title: “"Not the four star hotel as i expected"”
Reviews.Author: k00chie
Reviews.Content: Our family had been looking forward to stay in this hotel in our trip to Malaysia and Singapore because all our hotel bookings during the trip were only 3-star hotels except this one - we thought it would be a GRAND FINALE! To our dismay, the room was small, quite a bit old, breakfast not very good and worst, the air condition was not working well. When I complained about the warm room temperature, the maintenance only took the very dirty screen from the unit which did not solve the problem at all. The 3-star hotels we have previously stayed were far better than this one!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful People”
Reviews.Author: sksin
Reviews.Content: Good location hotel and wonderful cheerful service and helpful staff. Room need to do up compare to hotel we stayed before for our weekend hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Ozlady60
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I stayed in this Hotel, I think it is a fantastic spot with easy access to the railway, China Town, Clarke Quay, Litle India, Orchard Road and many more locations. We stayed in the Club Suite and found the service A1 and staff all very friendly and very helpful. I would not complain about the room size as we only used it to sleep at night and all other facilities were fantastic. The lobby decor is grandiose and loved the waterfall in the background.

Reviews.Title: “Good pricing but Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: vaibhav81
Reviews.Content: We got a decent weekend deal at approx USD$160 per nigh double room including breakfast and that was the main reason to stay here. The staff is efficient and nice. The only negative was the room size. Even though we stayed in the Cub Floor Deluxe room we thought the place was miniature. The hotel lobby and breakfast area is good, neat and clean. Location wise it is a short walk to the metro station and couple of shopping centres nearby. Overall good but I don't think we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars? Yeah, and I'm the Queen of England”
Reviews.Author: Pr0metheus
Reviews.Content: The Grand Park City Hall was touted by my holiday operator as a 5-star hotel. Maybe star ratings have undergone depreciation. I'd not rate it more than 3. Location's great. City Hall is pretty much central to the tourist circuit with Bugis, Raffles, the Merlion, the Clarke Quay, the Esplanade, all within a decent distance. The City Hall MRT station is a 2 minute walk, so you could get to anywhere in Singapore and not be lost when you come back to the City Hall station. The Funan IT Mall is also a 2 minute walk. That said, the rooms are amateur-designed. The entrance opens into the bathroom door, which incidentally has no ventilation. So live with the Parfum de Loo while you're here. The washbasin was cracked (the cracks were cement-filled, but the cracks were on glorious display). The potty doesn't have a jet-spray or hand-shower that is critical to everyone who doesn't simply wipe and forget. The minibar did not have many of the items listed on the minibar price list. The cupboard had one door unhinged. Despite knowing that we were a married couple, they gave us separate twin beds and could not shift us to a double-bedded room. Breakfast was nice-ish but not 5-star again. I had to remind them on 3 of the 4 days to refill the bowl of honey for the waffles. Housekeeping was responsive enough, though we have no idea of the room service. For some reason, they never placed the newspaper at my door, despite reminders each day. The stay was comfortable overall, given that we spent most time touring around. But for the USD 174 they charge, I just couldn't see the value for my money. I don't know how this hotel compares to the others in Singapore (we are not talking The Raffles or Swissotel here), so I'd give it a middle-of-the-road rating here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: saushukla
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel overnight while traveling on business to Singapore. I wanted a hotel which was close to the shopping district (Orchard Road!) yet also close to the business district of Singapore and found this hotel online! Booked the room online and reached and check-in without any problem! The MTR station is really close by so its easy to get to the Hotel from the Airport. I got a package with Free Internet and Breakfast included and felt I got a really good deal. Would definitely recommended this place to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Salgy25
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located with food courts close by. The rooms are not very large but good enough to be called spacious. The service and the staff is excellent! The bed has comfortable foam. Include breakfast in your package which is very elaborate. If you want to cheaper food the options are few meters away from the hotel in Penninsula Plaza. There is a food court which serves chinese, Korean, Singaporean, Indian etc. There is a famous South Indian restaurant as well by the name of Komala's.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Visit”
Reviews.Author: Eaton Bray Globetrotters
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a stop-over visit to Singapore staying at the Grand Park City Hall Hotel. We paid to upgrade to the Club Floor where the room was spacious, clean with a great view. The food and service were excellent. All the staff were friendly and helpful but I would particularly like to thank Kripa in the Club Crystal for her help in making our visit so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice spa, but good sized bedroom a little tatty”
Reviews.Author: Alistairio
Reviews.Content: This is a good enough hotel if you are staying for a night or two. Nothing special, however it is in a good location to go out in Singapore for restaurants, etc. I got a massage in the good spa which was a great way to remove any aches and tension from a long flight. Bedroom was a decent size, but a little scuffed here and there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Poppet12
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and were very happy with our stay. The hotel staff were fantastic and are the most professional hotel staff we have ever come across. The location is great as it is right by the City Hall MRT and Raffles City Mall. It's even within easy walking distance to Clarke Quay and the Marina. Our only complaint is that for a 5 star hotel the room wasnt really cleaned to a 5 star standard. You could see dust shawdows on ledges and some things were not cleared or put away by the housekeeping staff. However, it wasnt bad enough to throw your toys. If we go back to Singapore we would definately consider staying here again because it was very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Just the job”
Reviews.Author: HHandGH
Reviews.Content: Excellent comfy hotel, helpful staff, good rooms, location faultless, near Boat Quay. Taxis nearby. If you have late flight, they don't only store your luggage, they give you a room to shower in before you go the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great value for money.”
Reviews.Author: JJ181
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable and well located hotel. Transport, attractions, food and shopping are all within walking distance, and the staff are friendly and helpful. Rooms are comfortable and well appointed, and it was good to have a separate bath and shower. Breakfast was well presented, with a good range catering to all tastes, though the icing sugar on the French toast was a little odd. Good coffee too. The pool was a tad small but clean and well maintained. Only major gripe would be the drink prices, but that's common in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Quite well situated but in need of maintenance and renovation”
Reviews.Author: franb51
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its proximity to the river and price. I cant walk large distances at present and it is also close to the MRT. When we checked in we were told they'd upgraded us to a Deluxe Poolview room but on inspection it was very "average" and not very big. The Pool 'view' was tucked away in the corner so you couldnt see it anyway. We then changed rooms to a corner one as it was bigger which was better but still not what I'd classify as a 4-5* hotel. We tried to get upgraded to a Crystal Club room buit no luck. Our package included B/F and this was indeed a fabulous spread catering for all tastes.Bed was comfortable but shower recess dirty with soap scum and only 1 bar of soap left for sink and shower. Carpets were filthy too. No free internet or wi-fi here. No free water here either as they said tap water was 'potable'. Some of the Concierges were extremely helpful, others were not. There are local eateries round the corner which were cheap and quite safe to eat at as well as a small supermkt and a McDonalds which had free wi-fi as do most coffee outlest in S'pore. Handy to walk to MRT and 10 mins walk from Clarke Quay. Regarding recommending it - do your homework and see if there's anything better for the price as there are loads of hotels in this area. They also had a Spa attached but prices were extremely high.

Reviews.Title: “Mildewy”
Reviews.Author: ShortChang
Reviews.Content: I felt that this was a well situated hotel. Getting around the city, as well as to and from the airport was very convenient via MRT. It was a few blocks from Raffles and Suntec Mall. I enjoyed the included breakfast, as it included many options. The service was consistently prompt, and the staff seemed friendly. There is a fitness center and a swimming pool. They were average. As for the negatives: Singapore suffers from a humid environment, and this probably makes controlling the mildew very difficult. The shower curtain stenched of mildew and the air conditioning was old and musty. The carpet and curtains were clearly in dire need of updating. This was probably a very nice hotel in the past, but requires renovation. They do charge S$28 for internet, which is a little insane to me, because its more than half a month's cost of internet here in the states. But I think what bothered me the most was that the towels from the fitness/pool area had been poorly dried and smelled of mildew. I really hate that because then your whole body suffers from that disgusting smell.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, after 4 weeks of good quality hotels.”
Reviews.Author: aholden862
Reviews.Content: The stay in this hotel has been most disappointing, particularly as I rated the standards of Singapore hotels having stayed in Clarke Quay 3 weeks earlier on a two night stopover. It is rated as a 5-star hotel, but the room provided felt more like a 2-star hotel. The location is great and the hotel lobby looks presentable, but once you get to the hotel rooms, it is very disappointing. We were first offered a disabled room (my wife is partially sighted) and I think they thought they were doing us a favour. We had actually booked a Superior room and were informed that this room was a Deluxe. We immediately rejected this room as it smelt of damp & stale smoke. We were then provided with a 'Deluxe' room on the sixth floor which was drab and equally disappointing in its appearance and cleanliness. The carpet was dirty and does not appear to be vaccumed, the sheets and valance looked grubby and all in all the room had a tiredness to it.. The bathroom had no fan, there was mildew and mould over the grouting and wall tiles. The grouting looked as though it had been done by an amateur. The kettle did not turn off , so could have boiled dry if left. Front of house were courteous and efficient and I have no problem here. As this was our final leg of our months holiday and our second stop in Singapore, it took the edge off what had been a great trip, having stayed in a number of better hotels and apartments.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grand Park”
Reviews.Author: SaurabhNayar
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after seeing reviews on tripadvisor.com. I must say that I am very much satisfied with the hotel and its location. The room and bathroom are pretty clean and but little small. The hotel location is in middle of business center and you can get anything from the nearby stores, even for local travel, MRT station is at walking distance. Being an India and a vegeterian the hotel has some Indian restaurants nearby which are good for daily meals. Overall its was a great experience living here and would definitely like to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the room, restaurant, TV, Internet, and shower”
Reviews.Author: cbsteh
Reviews.Content: Grand Park City Hall (GPCH) is well located: within walking distance to Raffles City and other shopping malls, Clarke Quay, as well as to the MRT. The hotel is safe, clean, and the concierge is friendly (more so than those at the reception). The concierge is also more knowledgable about the city than those at the reception. Unlike some reviewers here, I did not experience any musty smell, moulds, stained carpets, or the hotel being stingy with the shower gels. Perhaps the hotel took notice and ratified these problems. That said, I was disappointed by the size of the room. It is a tad cramp. The mini bar area was also cramp. I had to rearrange the cups, kettle, tray, and other utensils so I had enough room to boil water and make my cup of tea! (No complimentary bottled water here) Also cramp is the shower. The shower door opens inwards, so once getting into the shower, you have to squeeze your body out of the way so that you can shut the shower door! Also cramp is the restaurant which serves breakfast. I had to navigate carefully around the serving counter so that I wouldn't bump into tables, chairs, and patrons. In all, I felt a little cramp staying here. The internet rate is cutthroat: SGD28 per day. At that price, only the desperate or ignorant would hand over their hard earned cash to surf the net. Lastly, the room TV also do not carry many channels or many varieties. In conclusion, GPCH is not quite worth the value it charges. Chris TIP: Surprisingly, many Singapore cabbies are not familiar with GPCH. So I advise you to print out the hotel's map (from their website) or carry the hotel key card (which shows the hotel's map) and show the map to the cab drivers. Alternatively, all cab drivers would know GPCH location once you mention that GPCH is at Coleman Lane, or near Raffles City or City Hall MRT.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing for a 5-star hotel by Singapore standards”
Reviews.Author: LLG27
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel on 2 occasions over the period of a month. The duration of my second stay was around 2 weeks, which gave me ample opportunity to observe and experience the merits/faults of this hotel. I regret to say that my stay in this hotel has been most disappointing, particularly as I have always rated the standards of Singapore hotels very favorably against standards in Europe. It is rated as a 5-star hotel, but feels more like a 3-star hotel. The location is great and the hotel lobby looks presentable, but once you get to the hotel rooms, it is very disappointing. I have stayed in 2 rooms in this hotel during this trip and can confirm that both rooms were equally disappointing in its appearance and cleanliness. Firstly, the superior twin rooms are smaller in comparison to other Singapore hotels that I have stayed in previously. The carpet is dirty and does not appear to be vaccumed by the room service staff (we found toe nails on the carpet that remained for several days and had to pick it up and dispose of it ourselves eventually). The bathroom has no ventilation fan, hence there were appearances of mildrew and mould over the grouting and wall tiles. The TV reception for the local TV channels was poor. The mattress seems worn out - one can feel a sinking 'dip' in the middle of the mattress and I have a normal BMI (i.e. not overweight). The room service staff appears to be rather lazy. For examples, they repeatedly did not bother to tidy away and wash up the cups or rinse the kettle and do not make the beds properly on a number of occasions too. They were also very stingy when it comes to replenishing the shower gels, shampoo etc. For example, they provided one small bottle of each item to be shared between 2 occupants in the room, while most hotels would supply two of each. Thus we went out to buy our own bottles of shampoo, shower gel etc. The hotel doormen only appear interested to greet the guests when you engage their services in luggage handling/ hailing for cabs(i.e. potential to earn tips) and for the rest of my stay, they did not bother to smile or greet me or my roomate when we pass them at the hotel entrance. It was as though we were invisible! They charge a very expensive rate to use their internet services and we subsequently discovered that it was possible to get free basic wi-fi services in Singapore, courtesy of the joint effort by the telephone companies in Singapore. Overall, the stay has been very disheartening and I would not choose to return to this hotel for my next trip to Singapore, despite its excellent central location.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel In City Center”
Reviews.Author: Hemant_Agrawal
Reviews.Content: The Best point about this hotel was its prime location. The service was very good.Only there was no complementary water (in Singapore tap water is portable, but for a water fearing Indian, i still prefer bottled water) An excellent spread for the morning Buffet. Very close to the prime shopping locations and wide range of multi cuisine restaurants(Decent number of vegetarian restaurants with McD, KFC, SUBWAY thrown in at Furan Mall). Boogey Street which is next metro stop is an excellent shopping for cheap street stuff. Its close to Jasina (a perfume addict paradise) and Furan Mall (a Techie Paradise, entire Mall dedicated to Electronics ).

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: jillyportsmouth
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on stopover to Australia. Lovely hotel with modern, very clean room. Great breakfast and swimming pool very welcome after a hot day sightseeing. Only use public transport whilst in Singapore as it was so good and cheap. The MRT was fantastic, even caught it back to airport. It was a nostalga trip for us as my Husband used to live on Singapore as a child with the British Army so he wanted to try and find the house where he used to live. We did manage it, which is a miracle as most of Singapore is new.

Reviews.Title: “High quality and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: akl_traveler36
Reviews.Content: This hotel is now my favorite hotel in Singapore. After a red-eye flight to Singapore i arrived early in the morning, way to early for checking, but despite that the hotel staff got me a room in 10 minutes! Room was clean and bed slept perfect, but then again any bed will do after 14 hours of flight. The hotel is only minutes away from a extremely large electronics shopping mall and overall at a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service from great staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Empirera
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a nice area of Singapore, plenty of shops and parks to wonder around. Hotel wa nicely decorated, rooms good, food excellent but the best thing was the service provided by the staff. My travel partner and friend uses a wheelchair and the hotel staff were incredibly helpful, would definately go back on our next trip to Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in ideal central location”
Reviews.Author: Passportholder
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. Upon arrival the reception staff were most helpful and the concierge team handled the luggage in a speedy and efficient manner. The room was a good size,air conditioned and cleaned to a high standard during the three days we stayed. A help yourself buffet style breakfast was excellent with a wide choice of food. We did not use the restaurant for lunch or dinner. The bar was well stocked and the service from the bar staff was very good. The concierge team were very helpful giving good advice on how to get to places, handling luggage and providing taxis. Overall the service provided by all throughout our stay was to a very high standard. Nothing was to much trouble. For example we were given a room to shower in early evening before setting off to the airport as we had checked out in the morning. Wi-Fi is available in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Ambience, Quality Service”
Reviews.Author: pratyax
Reviews.Content: It was first of all great visiting Singapore. Over and above the beautiful Singapore, the hotel too was fantastic. It was a great time being there. Quality service, swimming pool, Gymnasium, and especially the lobby was fantastic. I would surely recommend this hotel for the pleasant environment and prime location.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good location”
Reviews.Author: marcoclaudio
Reviews.Content: What you can expect from a 4 star hotel, basic, nothing more. Breakfast is quite average in terms of quality of the food and of variety. I had to change rooms twice as the first was overlooking a wall and the second was too small. the swimming pool is small and it is not attractive. Mostly asian customers. very noisy, people going up and down in elevators all the time. Location is fine, you can walk both to Orchard Road and the river or you can get the subway to go anywhere. all in all you can probably get better value for a few extra euros staying at a 5 star hotel like the Intercon.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you very much for your hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: yamazaki_h
Reviews.Content: When I am staying this hotel, I can always feel comfortable just like staying my home. Because all hotel staff are very friendly and provide me with excellent servises.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: ShepKincumber
Reviews.Content: I do highly recommend this hotel. Its is clean, good location to Clark quay, marina and train. Staff are more happy to help you. Internet is not free. Very nice breakfast buffet. Great happy hour with good entertainment in the evening. We have been to Singapore many time. Could be one of the best hotel I have stayed in before. We are going to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel in the heart of SIngapore”
Reviews.Author: aus_traveller_2010
Reviews.Content: We chose this spot as it was close to a MRT station, and short walking distances to areas such as Clark Quay, and some shopping centres such as Raffles and Funan. The staff were great, friendly and professional. Check in and check out was as smooth and professional as any top class hotel i have stayed at.
