We made a few requests to housekeeping and room service and they were fairly prompt in responding which was well appreciated. Rooms were standard, but had a quality feel to them, if that makes sense. Absolutely no issues at all with the staff, service or the rooms. Definitely would recommend to anyone looking for a well located hotel in Singapore, with a high standard of service and looking for a little bit of quality as well.

Reviews.Title: “worth it”
Reviews.Author: Karoltila
Reviews.Content: Great location, excellent service, beautiful view, nice staffs. The price is quite high but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Almost excellent”
Reviews.Author: weyling
Reviews.Content: This is my first holiday with my children to spore. After choosing so many hotels (many were fully booked) we finally decided to stay 4 nites in the park city hotel and 5 nites in copthorne's king hotel. It was great from the beginning we checked in, we got an upgrade to a deluxe room, the people were really friendly and helpful. The concierge were very helpful in assissting us on how to go to the tourist attraction as we always travelled by mrt or buses. They search the internet to find out the time or even called the place to make sure that they are opened (some are closed during xmas). We thank you so much to Mahendran, one of the concierge who always helped us to give direction. However, one thing I regret is the housekeeping not doing such a good job. They never washed our glasses or cups in our room until I complaint the third nite we were there. The table was dusty (wasn't there anyone stay there before us?) and never been cleaned up. To keep up your overall performance, please give some more training for them. I guess everyone agrees that we want to stay in the clean and healthy enviroment and don't want to get sick by using the glasses with germs(after a few days) in our holiday, right?

Reviews.Title: “Grand it is! Will stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Pinkstaceyanne
Reviews.Content: For our stay in Singapore we stayed at Grand plaza Park, we found it very central there are four shopping centers within 5mins walk and MRT is a 2 min walk.Our hotel room took about 25 mins before it was ready but they gave us a free drink while we waited, we stayed on the 9th floor with an ok view. Our room was clean small but enough room bathroom was quite nice, there were around 12 channels we only watched the movie channel and the australian channel as the rest were not in english lol. The pool was ok at night look alot better with the lights, spa was big for a spa and the fitness center was very good my partener approved. We had the breakfast included in our package and there is soooo much food lots of different things like noodles and lots of choices of fruit,cheese and drink. I think it cost aound $30, there bar is quite fancy no thongs or singlets and quite $$$ better to go down the road to chimes they have happy hour on all drinks at 3pm - 9pm. They have a spa there if you want to get pampered but you pay a high price $$$, they also have a koi fish pond nice to watch. The service was very very good they are there to serve you ask them anything, we even tipped we were so happy with how helpful they were. Overall this hotel is good hotel but a bit $$$ with food and drink but there are plenty of cheaper places around.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Member88
Reviews.Content: We are really pleased with our 1 day stay at the Grand Park City Hall hotel. Service at the hotel was friendly and our room was ready even though we arrived quite early in the morning. We were also asked if we would like a late checkout and given a free upgrade to a Clubroom. The room however feels and looks like any standard room despite the upgrade. It was clean and the king size bed was quite comfortable. The shower basin was however slightly stained, old and probably needed replacing. Breakfast was good with lots of variety. The hotel itself is conveniently located next to Funan Digital Centre where you can find floors and floors of computers and electrical equipments. Orchard Rd is not too far away. Overall the price is quite reasonable for an expensive city like Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible View and Strategic Location”
Reviews.Author: Duink
Reviews.Content: This is my fist time in Singapore and my office arrange my stay at Gran Park City Hall. The location is very strategic, near MRT station, near bus station, and located side by side with 2 big shopping mall. This hotel nicely located in the intersaction of colman street and hill street. The acces from Changi airport is very easy, just one changing MRT in Tanah Merah to City Hall. The room view is outstanding! My room is facing the intersaction between hill street and coleman street. The view of Singapore fire station and city light is really awesome. You can feel the Singapore energy and busy life from this side of room. Overall condition of the room is very good and satisfying. The one thing that bothers me is the limited toiletries in the bathroom, but then again it is not that significant, and off course the pricing.. for me is to much for this kind of room.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Park Hotel not so Grand”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustPerth
Reviews.Content: If it was not for the fact I love Singapore I would seriously consider not returning, so bad was our experience at the Grand Park City Hall Hotel. The fiasco that was our stay ranged from thread-bare, fraying bath towels to leaking vanity sinks (and I am talking the Niagara Falls of leaks) to bug infestations. Perhaps if our concerns had been handled with more aplomb and (something resembling) remorse my review would be a very different one, however this was not the case. Repairs were inconvenient and slow to occur and we were forced to change rooms on our last night amid assurances that the bugs infesting our room were not "very dangerous"! At no time was there any suggestions of complimentary services to make up for the disruptions or even a "sorry for the inconvenience". I have stayed at numerous Singaporean Hotels in the past and had hoped that my stay at the Grand Park would follow the trend of wonderful service and amenities, I was singularly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Get a "superior room", then enjoy, enjoy”
Reviews.Author: ChrisBa
Reviews.Content: This is my new 2nd favourite hotel in my worldwide ranking (replacing the Marina Mandarin in Singapore). I wanted to enjoy a little comfort on my stopover back from Australia, but since hotel prices had gone up quite a bit from my last trip 3 years previously, I opted for "only" a 4-star to treat myself after 5 weeks in Oz. The Grand Park City Hall had a bit of a cold welcome when I arrived late at night from the airport, since no more bell staff was on duty to get my luggage. But everything was uphill from there. The "Superior room" was considerably bigger than the standard rooms (see floor chart on the photo), which I also saw later after check-out, with big double bed, desk area, large marble tiled bathroom and semi-walk-in closet including safe, bathrobe and slippers. Room service was both quick and very affordable, bed was great to flop down on after a stressfull day of delays and long flight from Perth. Staff couldn´t have been nore helpful. The batteries went out in my TV remote and I mentioned that on the way out to get some food, it was fixed when I came back an hour later. I asked to have my luggage stored after check-out since my flight out was late in the evening and was offered the complimentary use of a room for half an hour to refresh myself for later when I came back from my city tour and before returning to the airport. This was a standard-sized room and while I don´t know the price, I wouldn´t have felt as comfortable staying there as in the bigger one. Location is great with an MRT station round the corner, the Singapore River just a stroll down two or three blocks, Fort Canning Park round the back and Bugis Street markets about 10-15 easy minutes on foot. Two circle line city tours stop nearby, too. Shopping for electronics is a must when in Singapore and "Funan Digital Life" mall is just across the street. Shops there are all well stocked, layed out and have new, reputable material. A lot less busy, crowded, loud and shady then what Sim Lin Square is nowadays. Breakfast was good, less european/continental variety, more asian delicacies, good choice of cooked/fried breakfast (eggs made to order if you wanted to) and also very heavy on the sweet selection (fresh waffles, pancakes with syrup). Stuffed myself silly on the sweet stuff the first day and lived to regret it as I couldn´t bear the sight of food for the rest of the day, should have paced myself. Internet was ethernet-cable only at the desk at reasonable price (some people reported billing issues in their reviews with changing computers, it looks like the billing is based on PC/MAC-address connected, not any-number-of-computers-per-room). Would definitely return to this hotel on my next venture into this part of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: firmanhadi
Reviews.Content: Great location. Unfortunately, the internet does not work.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing and comfortable weekend stay.”
Reviews.Author: TTMH
Reviews.Content: We stayed over for the weekend and several factors helped to make the stay a wonderful experience. The reception was fast and efficient with the check-in procedure. Rooms smelt great and are of a good size. Room service was prompt and helpful; plus they recently updated their wine list. Located only a few steps away from a Mass Rapid Transit interchange station that takes you to anywhere in good time and surrounded by shopping malls. And yet the location is quiet enough for a good night sleep. A hotel that gives its guests great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, perfect location, couldn't ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: Dublin_IrelandHelen
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived to the minute we departed the staff couldn't have done anymore for us. Always making sure we were ok and gave us directions to where ever we needed. Would certainly reccomend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Austravellers2009
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 4 nights at Grand Park City Hall and had a wonderfull time. The rooms were spacious, clean and the staff were very helpfull and friendly. The buffet breakfast was spectacular and even though the hotel was very busy, there was no shortage of food or seating. This hotel is in a very good location, being close to MRT, shopping malls and Clark Quay where there are some amazing restaurants. If you are travelling Singapore Airlines make sure you keep your boarding pass as this will offer discounts on the hop on hop off bus run by Singapore Airlines & also the Singapore Flyer, Zoo and many other attractions. Our check out time at the hotel was mid day and our flight did not leave until midnight but they offered us a room to freshen up before we were picked up for the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelln
Reviews.Content: I had the chance to stay at the GRAND PARK CITY HALL during my one week stay in Singapore. This hotel benefit from a great location and the service is really good! We went there with a group of nearly 90 people and all their feebacks regarding the hotel were also really good. An Hotel that I recommend in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: travelwithpeggy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for just 2 nights but I had moved from the Swissotel The Stamford. I had to stay at the Stamford for business for 4 nights. I didn't get to select that hotel. I was just placed in it. Well, it costs way too much for what you get. The Grand Park puts the Swissotel to shame. I have a lovely room with king bed, which is very comfortable. The room is large, even by U.S standards. I found the front desk friendly and helpful. I am on the Executive floor with a breakfast included and a Happy Hour with free drinks and great food. I had enough "snack" food that it was my dinner. When, I say snack food, I mean it had crab, salmon, cheese, and many other types of expensive excellent food. Now, the Stamford charged 260 SGD per night with an additonal 28 for Internet. A beer from the mini-bar cost a whopping 26 SGD. Those prices are just out of this world. At the Grand Park City Hall, I have a good location, with the price per night at 270 SGD per night with FREE Internet, breakfast in the Executive Lounge and their Happy Hour each night. Now why would you wnat to stay any where else? It wouldn't make any sense!

Reviews.Title: “Central location close to all amenities”
Reviews.Author: DoubleDSpain
Reviews.Content: Friendly hotel with very helpful staff. Comfortable and very clean with several restaurants and being in central location, close to all public transport, shopping centres and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally situated for stopovers”
Reviews.Author: ME&ERR
Reviews.Content: Generally I liked this hotel. The Staff especially the waitresses were friendly and fun and the reception staff were always so polite and helpful. The English breakfasts are very good and varied. The prices were not the cheapest but then apart from electrical goods nothing is cheap in Singapore. The rooms were OK, although unfortunately the bathroom in my room suffered from a slight drain problem and occasionally stunk of urine. We were only there for three nights so by the time we had figured out what the problem was it was not worth moving rooms, although it was offered. Our friends next door had no such problem. This hotel is well located for the river for shopping and for raffles hotel and is close to the MRT and bus routes. Orchard Road shopping is only a short taxi drive away but then being a small island everywhere is only a short ride away. Singapore it's self is well worth a stop over visit. It is such a clean, tidy and civilised place that that puts most other International cities to shame. They even drive on the right side of the road, the left. Take time out to visit the Orchid gardens

Reviews.Title: “There must be something better”
Reviews.Author: ianwilson
Reviews.Content: Small rooms (I was in a Deluxe), poor service, internet didn't work

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Babyghost
Reviews.Content: I am very happy to stay at Grand Park City Hall as they had provided an excellent and good quality service throughout my stay. all the staff there are very polite and friendly. Keep it up Grand Park Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this hotel for where it is situated and for helpfulness.”
Reviews.Author: mamacassLondon
Reviews.Content: Went to Singapore for the Grand Prix and this hotel was just 2 minutes away from Gate 4. The hotel staff were very helpful and the whole hotel we found to be very pleasant and would definitely go back again to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Service a standout!”
Reviews.Author: KGB_4
Reviews.Content: Like so many previous reviews, my stay at the Grand Park City Hall was lovely. I arrived around midnight after a long and delayed flight for a 24 hour stopover on my way to Europe. The staff at the desk were expecting me and had my booking details at hand almost as soon as I walked in the door. Within a minute, I had my room pass, and my bags were taken up. The 'bell-hop' showed me through the room and explained how to use the air con., phone, alarm etc. The room was spacious with a king bed - though I only booked a single. A huge bathroom with a big shower as well as a separate bath tub. Lots of green marble, plenty towels, with shampoo and lotions, there was nothing more I could need. Like others mentioned, I had a very late flight out. I recieved a 4pm complimentary checkout, had my bags stored until I returned after dinner, and then access to a room to shower and freshen up before my next long flight... Honestly, you need it after a hot, sultry, humid day in Singapore! Lastly, the location was fantastic. 500 metres to City Hall MRT, lots of places to eat and shop very close by, and a 5 min walk to Clarke Quay. I'm not a fussy traveller, but Grand Park City Hall really impressed me. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value with Singapore Stopover”
Reviews.Author: RichardandAmy
Reviews.Content: This hotel surprised us. We arrived on our first overnight stay at 8 in the morning. Our room was ready. We had to leave on our second stay at 8 in the evening and they let us stay in our room until 6 in the evening. The staff were constantly helpful and keen to be friendly. With the Stopover package from Singapore Airlines the buffet in the restaurant was half price and superb value for under £10. Breakfast was similar excellent value. The rooms are rather dull,city centre, business-orientated and could do with a comfortable chair or two!! Nevertheless the hotel's central location, superb public rooms meant that we felt we had excellent value for under £60 a night. Strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel - Grand Experience”
Reviews.Author: WendySouthAustralia
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Singa's several times, this has been the best hotel yet ! Staff were more than helpful. We were given early check in, an upgrade & late checkout all without asking ! Appearance of the hotel was modern & upmarket, location great, rooms quiet & bathroom toiletries nice. Would recommend 100%

Reviews.Title: “Good service but needs some upgrading.”
Reviews.Author: JayBees
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a two night stop over. The hotel is well located. The MRT is only a couple of blocks away and the restaurants of Boat Quay and Clarke Quay are within easy walking distance. The service in the hotel was generally very friendly and helpful and nothing seemed to be too much trouble for the reception staff. On the negative side, judging by our room, the bedrooms are in need of a fair amount of upgrading and refurbishment. There were signs of wear and slight grubbiness in several places in our room, the basin was a mosaic of cracks and the stopper was ineffective. Such a pity that the good service provided by the staff should be let down by the tiredness of the room.

Reviews.Title: “excelent”
Reviews.Author: franklin-Edgard
Reviews.Content: Excelent with VIP service - no surprices - kind and gentel staff , devoted too there clients

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dibby2008
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times. Have always found the staff to be exceptionally helpful and friendly. Central location, close to metro, downtown and restaurants. Business lounge staff are especially helpful. Great service and good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotelk in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: TFCLondon
Reviews.Content: This is a very central, large good value hotel in Singapore. Maybe the rooms are not as grand as the reception area, but overall I would recommend it to most travellers

Reviews.Title: “Grand Park City Hall is Singapore Service at it's best!”
Reviews.Author: MoniqueJeremiah
Reviews.Content: Recently I was delighted to have stayed at the Grand Park City Hall for a three week business trip in Singapore. The hotel was by far the most outstanding hotel I've ever stayed in so far. This is ultimately due to the unmatchable level of service and courtesy which all of the hotel staff, especially the front office and the concierge staff, provided to me during my stay, Every day and every night I was pleasantly greeted and assisted with all of my business and leisure needs and all of the staff made me feel like family and very welcome in a new country. I cannot be more appreciative of the staff at the hotel. The hotel also was superbly decorated and elegant from the hotel entrance, to the leisure facilities and of course inside the hotel rooms. The hotel room was extremely comfortable and spacious and serviced on a regular basis and the fitness centre and pool were all very well maintained. The hotel also was wonderful in looking after corporate guests by providing a lovely cocktail party every second Wednesday for guests to meet the managers and to get to know other hotel guests. It was a lovely gesture indeed. I would highly recommend the hotel to any business or leisure traveller and will be honoured to return to the hotel in future. Thank you to all the staff at Grand Park City Hall. By Monique Jeremiah

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade to CLUB ROOM”
Reviews.Author: HogesOz
Reviews.Content: On our arrival, a very courteous porter took our bags from the taxi and showed us to reception. At reception, I asked about the possibility of a late check out and internet access. The receptionist suggested that we upgrade to CLUB Room for an additional $60 per night. It was definitely worthwhile, We were given a 16.00 check out, unlimited internet access, breakfast in the club room as well as an free open bar and lovely snacks from 17.30 - 19.30 each night, and 2 free laundry items each day. All the staff was very friendly but in particular the three staff in the Club Room were brilliant. On our last day we went to the Club Room for a coffee at 3pm with the intention of then going to reception to check out at 4pm and wait in the foyer until 6pm for our taxi to the airport. John, the Club Room Attendant said that there was no need to do that. He would arrange the check out for us from the club room whilst we had our coffee. He then invited us to stay in the club room until our Taxi arrived and to partake in the food and Bar. He also arranged for our suitcases to be taken down to the foyer for the concierge to look after. The whole experience was very memorable. As other reviewers have noted, location is great, 5 minutes from MRT , Raffles City Shopping and Clarke Quay. The MRT is very easy to use and the trains are air conditioned. Our room on the 10th floor was large and very comfortable. Thoroughly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A neat and nice stay near the MRT”
Reviews.Author: Rodsteel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within 5 minutes of walking distance from the City Hall MRT station. And it is within walking distance to Suntec City, Marina Bay and Clark Quay. We took the early flight and the manager allowed us to have early check in and late check out. And because of early check-in, we got our room upgraded which come with the LCD tv. There were plenty of varieties offered for the buffet breakfast. The staffs are friendly and courteous and the room is clean and quiet although I find the toilet and the swimming pool is a bit small, but we are ok with it. The hotel is definitely value for money.

Reviews.Title: “a really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: roberto_from_manila
Reviews.Content: Its true what the good reviews said of this hotel. Nice rooms, distinctive lobby, excellent location and staff who were all very friendly and went out of their way to be of assistance. An example is that my wife was bothered by a flickering bath light at 10 pm one night. We called and within ten minutes they had a man to repair it. My wife did not like the spicy Malay foods featured this month, but there is no shortage of nearby places to go. Shopping and public transport were also within just a very short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Good 4 star hotel - very central to everything”
Reviews.Author: DLFAust
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice in 2 weeks July 2009 - before and after cruise on Virgo. Wanted a good 4 star that was not an airline tourist hotel and we got it. Lobby etc is very nice and breakfasts v.good. We paid little extra for the superior room and this got us a good rooms on both occaisions. Most rooms are executive/business setup which is what we like. As for anywhere in Asia - make sure you stipulate non-smoking when you book. First room (5th floor, at front) had seperate bath and shower which was very good, second (9th floor, around side) had shower in bath, this bathroom was bit smaller but room itself slightly larger with king size bed. Rooms were quiet and very little external noise. Staff were excellent and the facilities much better than the typical tourist hotels - on a par with most 4-stars in Australia-Asia. There is a Day Spa located in hotel complex and at present hotel guests get good discounts (very enjoyable, and worth having). Internet is available in lobby at S$4/15minutes, else public wireless hubs in general area. In-room access is available but expensive - if you really need it pay extra and get a room in the business floor (10th). The City Hall MRT station is a short walk around corner (200m) and once mastered makes travelling very efficient. Clarke Quay and Raffles City Plaza are only a walk away (500-700m) or indirect via MRT. Orchard Rd is 2 stops on the MRT. The heat/humidity is Singapore - if you do not like it then you should avoid Singapore or book a different noisy hotel right over a mall. Else grab a taxi to anywhere in CBD for S$7-10.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: SaldeanTripper
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Park City Hall hotel for three nights while attending an international conference in Singapore. After a long flight from the UK it's really important that the process of getting from the taxi to a shower or to bed is made as easy as possible. Not only is the lobby of the Grand Park cool (after the humidity of the street) and clean, but I also found the staff attentive, welcoming and efficient. My room was comfortable but nothing out of the ordinary, with not much of a view. However, it was cleaned and had broadband (not free), a safe for valuables and a nice walk-in shower. The restaurant serves good food, but was self-service (even at night) and resembled a refectory rather than a restaurant. This is only a comment on style, really. It was clean, with a wide variety of choice and, again, attentive staff. The location of the hotel is good. Very close to City Hall MRT station, close to Raffles Hotel (good cocktails!) and to the Suntec convention centre. The reason my overal rating of the hotel is high is predominantly because of the staff. Two examples among many. First, I needed a large amount of photocopying done for a meeting. Despite asking for this to be done between 8pm and 9am (at a weekend) the staff took on this challenge with no hint of irritation. Indeed, the task was completed early and I'm sure at least one member of staff worked late into the night. Second, having checked out on my last day I was able, as in many hotels, to store my luggage until later in the evening as I had a late flight home. On this occasion, when returning to pick up my bags, the staff gave me complimentary access to a room so that I could have a shower and change. This made a big difference to my level of comfort as I prepared for a 12 hour flight home, and I really appreciated it. I can recommend this hotel for business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: JenandBrad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights and we really enjoyed our stay. Firstly, the location of this hotel is fantastic. You can easily walk to Clarke Quay and Bugis Junction and even China Town, Little India and Kampong Glam are close enough to walk to if you don't mind breaking a sweat :). Furthermore, the City Hall MRT station is right around the corner and two lines run through this station, so it is really convenient. Secondly, the breakfast buffet was amazing. We were lucky enough to get a deal through wotif.com that included breakfast and it was really worth it. There was so much to choose from, it was delicious. Thirdly, the staff were very helpful - particular thanks goes to the concierges who booked a restaurant table with a view for us and a trip to the zoo for breakfast with the orangutans (recommended!) but all staff throughout the hotel were very friendly. Lastly, the rooms were nice. The bathroom had a big bath in it and there was plenty of room. The only negatives that we experienced were that sometimes the tv reception was bad (not that we had much time to watch tv anyway) and that twice the water in the shower was only warm, not hot, although this was only a problem for me, not my partner. Overall we had a great stay and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Manegerial Staff helped me in purchasing Japanese Dictionary which my niece wanted urgently...”
Reviews.Author: prdamle1947
Reviews.Content: Dear Sir, Recently I stayed at this hotel VIZ, "Grand Park City Hall" at 10, Coleman Street, Singapore 179 809 along with my wife from 05/06/2009 to 07/06/2009 for Leisure Trip through "Sachin Travels, Mumbai, India"..... I am pleased to say that this Hotel is extremely comfotable with decent rooms, delicious food and courteous service... Moreover, the Hotel Manegerial Staff helped me promtly in purchasing the "Japanese Dictionary", which was wanted by my niece urgently.... Thanking you, Yours sincerely, (P. R. Damle) 10/06/2009

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Luv2TravelOS
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel recently with my mother on a two day stopover. We love Singapore because it is so clean, friendly and safe for women travellers. This hotel was on the Singapore Airlines stopover list and although I have been to Singapore on five previous occassions I had never stayed at this hotel before as I usually stay on or near Orchard Road. I was impressed with the staff who were very helpful and polite, we arrived about 8.30am and they gave us our twin room straight away which was wonderful as we had flown overnight and were desperate for a rest. The room was clean, quiet and with comfortable beds. The location was good as the SIA Hop on Bus stop was close by so we used that as well as taxis to get around the city. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly located”
Reviews.Author: prrchander
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at The Hotel Grand Park City Hall,Singapore during my company trip with my dealers.It was my first international travel and quite an experience was it. The hotel is located right in the commercial district of Singapore. A drive of under 2 SGD to Clarke Quay makes this location an amazing one. I was able to reach the hotel after shopping at Mustafa Centre in the middle of the night(3 am) with under 10 SGD. Such was the location. Well appointed rooms but room service can be better. City view from the hotel is very good.I liked the stay and would recommend the same to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Happy in the City”
Reviews.Author: ktine203
Reviews.Content: My partner selected the hotel thinking the malls will be a step away. We ended up with the Funan mall nearby which specializes in electronic and computer products.. The upside is it is a good 6 to 10 minute walk to the City Hall MRT station. The only downside to walking in Singapore is the humid heat of its weather so be prepared to sweat it out. The hotel is a bit out of sight from the main road and not much taxi drivers know the place (or perhaps i have a problem pronouncing the name of the hote), The location makes it a bit difficult to get a cab or taxi as it is along a main road... so be prepared for a long wait or perhaps call to book a taxi instead. The place is pretty central, it is a walk away to Boat Quay, Clark Quay and Esplanade...also near the raffles shopping centre and Supreme Court building. As to the room we got, it does not come up to my expectations. Walls are rather thin. We can practically hear the other people talking and laughing in the other rooms. I also get awaken by someone opening their rooms (sounds like our room was the one being opened). Room too is rather small with just basic work desk... no couch for day reading. The hotel also forgot to provide us with the basic toiletries expected like disposable shavers, cotton buds, toothbrushes and toothpaste.. Oh and they forgot to provide us with bedroom slippers so had to walk on the cold floor of the bathroom. The hotel has a well equipped gym but their pool is rather small though it is clean. The jacuzzi is also clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: scliffy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights during May in a deluxe room. It was an excellent choice. Whilst the rooms are not as luxurious as the public areas, they were more than adequate and comfortable. The location was perfect for all the activities we planned. Easily central for walking to many tourist and shopping sites. We found the nearby Raffles City Mall one of the best and had no trouble finding plenty of eating places around, especially at Clarke Quay. When we tired of walking we used the MRT with no problems and the station was literally just around the corner. The MRT was so clean and efficient it was a pleasure to use. The concierge was always cheerful, helpful and arranged several tours for us. The cleaning staff were thorough and the toiletries plentful.. We did not eat at the hotel breakfast buffet, but found a small "BreadTalk" nearby where we had a "Rise and Shine" breakfast (inc. orangeJuice) for $2.20, extremely good value for those who don't do justice to a hotel breakfast. We did eat in the Coleman Cafe downstairs one night when we were lateback after the Night Safari excursion, the meal was not more that barely adequate, warm greasy and tasteless. But it was late and the Malls had closed early. If you can book this hotel at a discounted rate, then it is good value indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: jollytinman
Reviews.Content: First impressions was one of luxury and we were not disappointed. Staff were welcoming, helpful, informative and always around if you needed help. The room was clean and spacious and comfortable. The bathroom was of excellent decor to a high standard. The minute you leave the hotel all is there to be experienced i.e. walking distance to shopping centres , restaurants, sight seeing attractions. Public transport is accessible and taxi's were reasonably priced. The Hotel is situated about 5 to 10 minutes from China Town by Taxi and 20 minutes walking. Least liked the fact that you are unable to open the windows to let in natural air. Restaurants on site were expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, friendly staff, good facilities, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: kaz747
Reviews.Content: Arrived on an early morning flight and were able to check straight into rooms which was fantastic. Also received a late check out at no extra charge. Nice rooms, lovely pool and spa area, well equipped gym. Location is good - walking distance to Clarke Quay and MRT station. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Potential ... but”
Reviews.Author: MonsClaude
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in great location close to Raffles City and City Hall MRT. Staff were helpful and knowledgable. Restaurant buffet looked great and good value. Only negatives were the room (standard) we were in needed a makeover as carpet was old and not clean and the shower was only luke warm. Bathroom was large and very clean. Perhaps the more expensive rooms have been upgraded.

Reviews.Title: “Very central”
Reviews.Author: Janulik
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, very close to MRT City Hall, Raffles Shopping complex and City Mall shops, about 25 min walk to Suntec City. The rooms are not big but you don't come to Singapore to stay in a hotel. We didn't use the restaurant at all as there is so much amazing food elsewhere. Some people mentioned before thin walls, well all hotels in Singapore we stayed before were the same, you could hear people walking in the corridors but definitely not TV from next rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Conviniently Located and Good Property”
Reviews.Author: stdbxr11
Reviews.Content: Property is centrally located in City Hall and is a walk away from Raffles Square. The property by itself is modern and well maitained. The service of the staff was comparable to 5 star standards.

Reviews.Title: “the best trip ever”
Reviews.Author: kenandyvonne
Reviews.Content: We have spent many holidays in Singapore over the last 15 years and have stayed at several different hotels. This time, on the recommendation of a friend we stayed at the GRAND PARK CITY HALL in Coleman Street, the duration of our stay was 13 nights. The hotel is rated at 4 ½ stars and priced accordingly. It is centrally located to many points of interest that are in walking distance. On our arrival, the porter greeted us with a warm welcome, removed our bags from the taxi and ushered us to the reception counter. We had decided to upgrade to a CLUB ROOM and pay the difference on arrival. This caused no problems and we were in our room within 15minutes of arrival. They were finishing the renovations to the clubrooms while we were there, so the “cocktails” were served in the sunken dining area. This was a real bonus, as most nights there was a live band playing in the adjacent area and each night this turned out to be a very relaxing way to end the day. This was also a great way to meet some of the other people staying in the hotel. We even had many meals in the hotel as we considered them fair value for money, and there was an interesting variety of foods. Our room was ample in size and the furnishings were in good condition and had no indication of damage from prior occupants. The staff are extremely friendly and courteous, from the floor managers to the cleaning house cleaners. Our interests in Singapore are more aligned to relaxing, than playing tourist and the GRAND PARK CITY HALL suited our needs exactly Subject to finance, we will be back in 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, shame about the rooms”
Reviews.Author: soosiesoosoo
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple of nights here as a stopover on the way back from Oz. It was a bit on the expensive side but we were willing to pay for the central location. If you only have a day or two then this hotel is fantastic for being right in the centre of Singapore. The hotel lobby and bar are very plush and the staff are very attentive. But the room was rather disappointing. They are pretty small and the decor is fairly average. The cleaniness in the room wasnt very inspiring either. There were stains on the carpet and the bathroom wasnt exactly spotless. To make it worse, the sheets on our bed felt damp, but we were told this was due to the recent humidity. We were however offered another room and our checkout time was lengthened, so we were impressed with the staff for their helpfulness and patience! Altogether great for location alone, but rooms a bit disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant city hotel in unbeatable central location”
Reviews.Author: Townsiders
Reviews.Content: The title says it all - this is a good quality city hotel in a superb central location, walking distance to everywhere and much more convenient for sightseeing than being stuck out on Orchard Road or the Marina. It is near an MRT station for easy access, very near to Raffles hotel and to Clarke and Boat Quays for alfresco eating. Walking distance to Chinatown as well. The room itself was modern and clean, if a bit small (especially the bathroom) and with no view. The hotel itself is comparatively small compared to some in Singapore! We upgraded to a club room and felt on balance it was worth it (child-free floor, breakfast and free drinks between certain times). The hotel is geared up for business travellers and is being upgraded all the time. We would happily return next time we are in Singapore - Singapore itself is an incredible place for food! We have never seen so many restaurants in one place!

Reviews.Title: “Reservations...”
Reviews.Author: buster3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on the way back from a holiday in Thailand. We had originally made a reservation at this hotel in MAY 08 for our Jan 09 visit, t ostay in a Superior King room with Spa. We arrived very late at night & when checking in realised that our request for a smoking room had been overlooked, after some indecision we were told we would be upgraded(???) to a deluxe smoking room fitted out for the disabled. At 2.00 am in the morning after hours of travel by car & plane you dont feel much like arguing. When we entered the room we were both overwhelmed by the strong cigar odour, but we put our heads down for some much needed sleep (with the DND sign in place), until at about 7.00am the door bell woke us & there was a staff member asking us if we were checking out. After sending her on her way, we returned to sleep only to be woken at 9.00am by a staff member asking if we had any laundry. We were getting pretty annoyed by this stage. There were no other suitable rooms for us to be moved to & so we remained with the aid of some strong incense and room freshener. I had stayed at this hotel before and had been very happy with the room/facilities and service. I won't be going back again..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location: delighful stay”
Reviews.Author: Carol S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in two locations during our January 2009 stay in Singapore. The other hotel (Traders) was located in the Orchard Rd vicinity. Our stay at Grand Plaza Park Hotel City Hall was incredible. We walked into the lobby and I immedialtely thought how tasteful this place is. There is a lovely water feature, beautiful ceramics and glimpses of the internal shophouses. The staff are very polite and friendly. The rooms and bedding are very comfortable and what is nice about this place is that they are maintaining everything. Whilst we were there they were in the process of upgrading the lifts and shophouses. That's a good sign as you know that the hotel will never go through that period where everything just looks tired. Breakfast was really nice ( a great buffet selection) and Sabrina our sweet waitress always made us the best coffee each morning. Now the location of the Grand Plaza is also great. Within a 10 minute radius you can walk to the Esplanade, Boat Quay, Raffles, Chimes, City Hall Station, Fort Canning park, Marina Square, Empress Place, the Singapore River, The Central shopping mall and Funan Digital Life Mall (elecrtonics). The SIA hop on hop off bus is just opposite Funan Digital Life lakk (a 5 minute walk max from the hotel). I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore Airlines Stopover”
Reviews.Author: Huuhkaja
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Singapore Airlines Stopover Holiday programme. We stayed here two nights before flying to Australia and this hotel had all one can need for relaxing city stay. The room was very clean and tidy, there was good amenities like bath rope, slippers, hairdryer, minibar, comfy bed and so on. All the basic luxuries one needs for hotel stay. However the only minus was a small room. There is enough room for two, but still for Singapore it was small one. And we had a view to the street above main entrance, and there was a dark gray building right opposite of us as Coleman street is narrow. So no view. However the room was quiet. Staff was very helpful and polite, pool area was nice, also breakfast was good. Location was great for sightseeing, bars, restaurants, shops and so on. Also lobby bar prices were not that high as I expected. Highly recommendable for short, relaxing stopover/ stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tuscanyid
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights there to celebrate the New Years Eve in S'pore. Charming hotel in the very strategic location with proximity to the MRT and many interesting places. The room size is fair with a big double bed and nice touch of decoration, tough I found that the half/half curtain is rather weird considering the function. The bath room size is pretty small but nice tough need some improvement on the layout, it has very limited space to put your toiletries.The staff are courteous and helpfull. The breakfast was great, the food tastes nice, the cafe location and interior is charming. Good value and alternative for hotel other than those lining the Orchard and Marina area(which are getting more expensive nowadays) .

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, complicated internet access”
Reviews.Author: ddung
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on reviews from TripAdvisor, 4stars classification and price. We spent the New Year night in the hotel too with the hotel organised party in the main hallways and club/bar (except the countdown when we went to see the Singapore Marina fireworks). The overall impression was quite good, very good location - close to everything in Singapore and the MRT, very comfortable bed and good quality linen and the fees/ prices are reasonable good value for money given the overall Singapore prices... The cleaning ladies are good and smiling, the dealings with most of the front desk personnel reasonable. I had two issues during our stay: the main one is the Internet access. It is incredible that in 2008 there is such a problem to connect to Internet in this "4 stars" hotel! The normal fee is AUD 28 (approx USD24) per 24 hours (!!!) or AUD120 for 7 days (!!!). This is a wall / network connection with a short cable, hence no way to browse from the bed. During our stay we bought a new laptop and when trying to access Internet with the new laptop the connection was not working. After quite a few of phone calls to the front desk and a visit from quite a nice gentleman (service manager) we managed to fix it - initially I was told that the connection cannot be transfered from one machine to another?!?. Overall we wasted about 6 hours of our precious holiday time (and probably used the Internet in total 3....4 hours at the most over the 7 days) . We wanted Internet just for brief access times when buying stuff (for reviews and specs) but it became an expensive ($120) , time consuming and source of frustration exercise (and a lot of explaining to the big boss / wife). The other (minor) thing was after the countdown / new year at the hotel party - all was very well until 1AM when just when the guests were really enjoying themselves with most old and young dancing the floor, the band / organiser got tired or bored (who knows) and decided to suddenly close it off !!! , even if initially when asked, the hotel personnel said that the party will go on until 2AM or later if the guests are enjoying.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Time at the Park”
Reviews.Author: jatv
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel for three wonderful nights and enjoyed every minute of it. We availed of the hotel's weekend promo and was even upgraded to a de luxe room. The hotel is currently undergoing renovation though disturbance is kept to the minimum. Food was excellent and we love their breakfast. The staff were great and provided us with much help when needed. We also love the location its less than 5 mins away from the sub-way station and nearest shopping area. You can also walk to nearby tourist spot like the Singapore flyer, Esplanade and Merlion park. Will definitely stay here again. Though this hotel is not for the budget conscious, but you'll get your money's worth once you try it.

Reviews.Title: “A few anomalies”
Reviews.Author: perryw
Reviews.Content: I stopped by this hotel in early November 2008 and at first it seemed quite alright. However, as I stepped through the entrance, nobody offered any hint of wanting to assist with my luggage. The lobby was very well presented and modern, clean and luxurious. The check-in staff was not amazingly friendly but this being Singapore, where the hospitality standards are probably a little behind Thailand for example, I suppose it was quite standard. Check-in was quite shocking due to the extreme rudeness of one customer who just handed his passport to the check-in staff and said he'd like to check in, while I was still in the process of being checked in. The whole experience raised questions as to what the hotel staff should do or could do when faced with unreasonable customers who nevertheless bring their custom. Surely, they can't be tolerated to no end. Upon walking to my room, I found it was a very long walk from the lift. The room was quite pleasant, it was clean but the decor and furnishings a little dated as was the carpet. I would say it had a slightly old feel to it, especially the bathroom. The hotel itself is quite close to some shopping centres but the ones in the immediate vicinity are quite dated. The modern Funan IT Lifestyle mall is very closeby. Also, Clarke Quay is quite closeby. Furthermore, there is a central MRT station 2mins walk away, which means that it's easy to get almost anywhere in Singapore quite quickly. My room partly had a good view of the city but was also opposite a very old office building block which wasn't that pleasant a sight. Check-out was another weak point, I was immediately behind customers who took more than 15 mins to check in so was forced to wait a while, I just can't understand how it could take that long to check somebody into their rooms. The staff member manning the entrance went to the front desk and assisted another customer who arrived in the other queue after I had arrived and upon assisting this customer, left to man the front entrance again leaving me in the lurch. It just wasn't quite good enough and overall I would rate my experience at this property as being a bit haphazard.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Plaza Park Hotel City Hall”
Reviews.Author: SydneyToscar
Reviews.Content: Rooms not overly spacious & bathroom very small, although adequate & very clean. A la carte breakfast menu limited and nothing special although staff attentive & eager to please. Concierge & door staff very helpful. Average value for money, but probably reasonable for Singapore where accommodation seems to have got quite expensive over the last couple of years. Conveniently located near MRT station (10 minute walk), shopping plazas, convention centre (20 minute walk) & away from the frantic pace of Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but ageing & poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: Mark_from_Thailand
Reviews.Content: The Grand Plaza is located very well with very easy access to Orchard Road. The reception is efficient, the staff very helpful indeed. As other reviewers have noted, they try very hard to please. The rooms are adequate. Nothing very special, decent bed, decent TV & Internet access. However, possibly my fault as I booked the same week I stayed there - I found it VERY expensive for what was on offer. I paid SG$ 450++ for an "Executive Floor" room. The Executive Floor lounge is small & the breakfast is limited to say the least. The bedroom I was in was fine & relatively modern but the bathroom was old fashioned & the shower was older than me! All in all, fine hotel, great service but way over priced for what you get in my case.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Grand Plaza Park”
Reviews.Author: Moyglas
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Grand Plaza Park Hotel for 2 nights on a stopover in Singapore. On arrival the reception attendant was extremely polite and helpful and this set the tone for the rest of our short but enjoyable stay. The room was clean and big enough for the two of us. The breakfast buffet had everything you could want. On the second evening we had a drink in the bar while we listened to the live music. All in all we enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Happytlvr
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as part of the Singapore Airlines stopover. Was given a free upgrade to the 7th floor. The room was large and very clean. Service in the hotel could not be faulted. No matter what we asked for it was no trouble at all. The lady that did the room of a mornig was very helpful when asked for additional tea and milk. Each day when we returned there was additional tea and milk left for us. On the day of departure the hotel gave us a late checkout to 4.30pm. I would have no hesitation in staying here again and would recommend to anyone. Location brilliant, staff and food first class.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: eastland
Reviews.Content: Good value booking via ba.com. This hotel offered us everything we expected. I'm suprised to find others suggest that the rooms were shabby or dark. Maybe we were lucky as our room was freshly painted and well lit. The furnishings were modern (including an excellent full size desk) and the only thing that possibly needed replacing was the slightly worn carpet. Staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was fantastic and plentiful. Pool, although not large, was refreshing. All in all a great stay and we will be returning on our way back to the UK next year. The clincher is the location. Easy walking distance of all that you might want to see in the city and only 200m from the metro if you want to explore further. Unless you have heaps of luggage (we did but left it in storage at the airport) you can easily get here on the metro without breaking sweat - well maybe a bit :-)

Reviews.Title: “Solid, but not grand”
Reviews.Author: mondrian
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly respectable hotel, but you might expect better. The location is nice -- just a few blocks from the raffles hotel and shopping center; easy access to the riverwalk and to the subway. My room was well-maintained and fairly comfortable, but it was small and the window faced a wall. The front desk is efficient, but the concierge desk was pretty usefull-- they could give out brochures and make bookings, but were not knowledgable.

Reviews.Title: “service through gritted teath!”
Reviews.Author: gorgeous_uk
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were delighted to be told that we had been upgraded to a club floor room. The room itself was small, the bathroom tiny and the decor and lighting were poor. Internet access was available for a reasonable fee. After a long flight we were hoping for a lie in, sadly this was not to be as despite having the do not disturb sign on the maid ricocheted through the door armed with a vacum cleaner at 8am claiming not to have seen the do not distueb sign. A call to receiption failed to get an apology for this so they were not off to a good start. That evening we though we would check out the club lounge only to find out that as ''upgrades'' we would be charged for everything in the lounge - I mean that is like getting an airline upgrade to business class and being served economy class food. Bearing in mind we had not asked for the upgrade and it probably only occured becuase the hotel had oversold its standard rooms that came as yet another dissapointment. The service was extreamly average for Singapore, food was pretty much ok and in terms of location then the hotel is well placed for all the major shopping and entertainment areas.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, best service ever”
Reviews.Author: ridgePerth
Reviews.Content: We had a one night stopover on our way back from Europe and from the moment we arrived to our departure, we experienced excellent service from every staff member. The check-in was fast and efficient and we were given a room straight away despite arriving mid morning. The room was very good with a view of Singapore and every time we walked in or out there was someone ready to help us. Everyone was so charming, smiling and helpful. We wished we had stayed another night. Highly recommend this hotel because of it's service, location. Coud not fault in at all. chantal

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For Our Needs”
Reviews.Author: Bootle45
Reviews.Content: I flew out to meet my teenage daughter who was arriving from Cairns, we wanted a centrally located hotel which didn't cost the earth and this hotel certainly fitted the bill. We caught the MRT to City Hall and the hotel was just around the corner, easy even with luggage! The room was fine twin beds, mini bar with fridge space for our own drinks! I have to say the only criticism was that the shower was never really piping hot. There is a swimming pool and well equipped gym on the third floor, very relaxing in the late afternoon. A nice touch is that you check out at noon, the hotel store your luggage and you can use the gym shower to freshen up before your evening flight. Raffles City Shopping Centre is two minutes away, there are several mini markets close by and the Quays are within easy walking distance, quicker than taking a taxi! We paid £95 per night for the room including tax and service, which seemed good value to us by Singapore standards. Never used the restaurant or bar so can't comment. Staff very friendly and helpful. Would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable, Comfortable, and Well-Located”
Reviews.Author: NaMakani
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent six nights here in April ‘08. We recommend it for its comfort, price, and location. The Grand Plaza Park City Hall is a medium-size hotel located a short walk from the Raffles City shopping complex which houses the City Hall Metro station. Most of the major sights in central Singapore are within easy walking distance from the hotel, and all others are accessible via the Metro. For example, it is just a 10-minute walk to the Singapore River, the Asian Civilizations Museum, the National Singapore Museum, and other sights in the colonial area. The hotel has recently been updated and the large, open lobby is very attractive. Our room (810) was moderately large and attractively furnished with a very comfortable king bed, minibar and small refrigerator, coffee maker, t.v. stand, desk, a small table and a reading chair. The bathroom was good sized with marble tile, a tub/ shower combination, and plenty of counter space. In summary, the Grand Plaza Park City Hall is a very comfortable, moderate-range hotel in an excellent location. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: RoRoBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Our check-in was slow, but led to a room upgrade which was an unexpected and pleasant bonus. The room was large and very well furnished in a modern Asian style. However, the foyer, particularly the soft furnishing, was a bit tired and could do with an upgrade. On first morning we were still in the room when the staff came to service the room at 9.30am. When we returned at 2.30pm it still hadnt been done, which was disappointing. They eventually arrived at 2.45. The hotel is in a great location for shopping, sightseeing and the MRT.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven or . . . .”
Reviews.Author: OKAussie
Reviews.Content: This is a saga of my stay in Singapore which began like a perfect stopover after a long journey back home after 5 weeks touring Turkey. I'd experienced every sort of accommodation & now Singapore was to be my 5 star experience. And it was, to start with. We arrived well before check in & they kindly gave us a beautiful room immediately. The reception is decked out in granite, the staff were polite, efficient & delivered us to our room in an orderly, friendly manner. We had a 3 day stay, breakfast was an extra charge but we took advantage of the Singapore Airlines stopover discounts & received 50% reduction on our charge for breakfast. The porters, concierge always greeted us as did the restaurant staff. There are about 6 lifts, its fully airconditioned, beautifully appointed with white towelling robes. The continental breakfast buffet was well worth it at S$15. We had a late check out & use of gym, pool & shower to freshen up before our late flight. Of all the hotels we had stayed at over our 5 weeks travelling - this was to be THE best. One unfortunate encounter left a sour taste & I hope it won't happen to anyone else. The bar has a happy hour which we also took advantage of & enjoyed a drink, noticing that the staff were a little pushy about removing unfinished drinks & eager to serve more. A little unsettling. Later that night, I sat outside the bar waiting for my husband (listening to the music) & a young bar female staff member rudely asked me leave the area, why? because I was not drinking. I reported this comment to the manager the next morning who apologised & said they were trainee staff & gave me a free drink voucher. However, the damage had been done. It had put a cloud over my stay. The moral here is 'stand your ground' & if a member of staff gives you a hard time ask for the manager immediately. I felt that this behaviour was unacceptable in any form. To his credit, the manager repeatedly asked if there was anything further he could do for us & was most embarrassed by what had transpired.

Reviews.Title: “Where to stay in Spore”
Reviews.Author: Helen57Australia
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Grand Plaza Hotel, Singapore for 3 nights. Good location and very clean room. Receptionist was excellant. Arrived at 7 am after a long flight and it was pouring rain outside. It was understandable that I needed to wait for someone to checked out before I can have the room so I waited about 40 mins. I had a good rest before I started my day fresh. The room is a bit small good enough for 2 people and the set back is the swimming pool and gym is another block away. It would be nice to use the facilities. The housekeeping staff were warm too. Plus side the MRT is 5 mins away and plenty of eateries. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for money and outstanding service.”
Reviews.Author: meatcleaver76
Reviews.Content: I must say that on my stay at Grand Plaza Park Hotel City Hall I was a bit apprehensive that it would not really be up to standard and after checkin it seemed my fears where about to come true. To be fair I had checked in about 5 hours early, though this did not seem to be a problem - I was then given a room and to my dismay it had not been cleaned from the last guest. I went to reception and complained and within seconds they were on the phone to housekeeping and giving them the riot act. They also upgraded my straight away and where very apologetic and the reception manager had also become involved. I was then given a room of which my security card did not work and after trying for about 10mins decided to return to reception yet again. I actually found this quite amusing with reception looking very worried - they where ever so helpful in getting the problem sorted and also gave me free drink vouchers in their cafe/bar. Once finally in my room - large, comfortable and clean though nothing outstanding I had no further problems with my stay, well except for falling asleep in the Spa having a massage after a long flight and 36 hours with no sleep. This place seems well frequented by regular business travellers and the bar and resturant downstairs where also quite popular with locals as well, always a good sign. The resturant is nothing to write home about, though the food was nice and fresh. I would happly recommend this place to anyone looking for a good, clean hotel with outstanding service. Better than a lot of 4/5* places I've stayed at. Cant wait to see what the place would look like with a bit of a renovation and update of rooms. I'll be staying here next time on my way through - excellent value for money. rgds B.Cleaver

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: temple45
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Grand Plaza Park Hotel. We were on a stopover of 2 nights each way to and from New Zealand. On our first stopover we booked a Club Room (floor 9) and were so impressed we upgraded for our return visit and we were given a room on floor 10 which was even better. After a tiring day of sightseeing etc it was lovely to be able to relax around the pool area. I have never been in a hot pool that was so hot! Staff were very friendly and efficient. Could not fault the hotel at all. The location was spot on. Easy to walk to the Boat Quay and Clarks Quay. Walked to Chinatown, but due to the heat we had to get a taxi back! Close to all other areas and the MRT is just round the corner, which is clean, efficient and cheap. Loved Singapore and will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeSam13
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this hotel prior to and after a cruise originating in Singapore. We chose the hotel based on reviews from TripAdvisor travellers and after reviewing comments on the original hotel selected by our travel agent. Upon our arrival at the hotel, we were surprised to learn that it was the same one we stayed in 7 years ago, albeit with a somewhat different name. The front office staff were both welcoming and professional - they also upgraded us to a Club floor! The room was large and well-appointed with a mini-bar fridge and coffee/tea-making facilities. It was also non-smoking and contained the queen-sized bed requested by our travel agent.. The hotel is clean and well-maintained and beautifully appointed throughout all of its public rooms. Staff at all levels were friendly and efficient, especially the concierge and front desks. Our booking also included an American breakfast which did not disappoint and which contained both Asian and Western fare. We used the lovely outdoors roof-top pool which is surrounded by lush shrubbery and fountains. The hotel's location and Coleman Street is ideal for walking tours of Singapore and is only 10 minutes walk from Clarke Quay. A good choice of hotel at a reasonable rate and it will be, once again, our home-from-home on our next visit to exciting Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel but Above average Service”
Reviews.Author: Nonnapn
Reviews.Content: The Grand Plaza Park Hotel is in a very good location if you're in Singapore for shopping because it is just outside the Funan IT Mall, very near the Suntec Mall and Marina Square and is across the City Hall MRT station -- where you can get on the MRT and in ten minutes you're in Orchard Road for more shopping. Also, it's just a hop and a skip to the smaller Raffles City Mall where there's a great mix of brand name stores. Unfortunately, I can't bring myself to rave about the hotel facilities as I found the rooms and the amenities to be much less than what I had expected for the price they charged. The room was small and quite worn down (with a large and scary stain on the carpet). The furniture really needed to be changed and the beds were not too comfortable. The business facilities were much better. The function rooms were very nice, high ceiling, spacious and very conducive for meetings. Service though was very warm, attentive, efficient. All staff had a professional yet welcoming air. I was impressed with check in and check out service as it was conducted with great speed and courtesy. Doormen and bellhop service also very efficient and on the night I checked out, which was quite late, the doorman had to go out and secure a cab for me on the main road -- everything was done with great service. I was quite impressed. I give the hotel top marks for service but they do need a major renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kob
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a stopover after reading tripadvisor reviews. We couldn't have been happier. Every staff member has been so helpful and friendly and effiicient - without being over the top. Nothing is too much trouble. We arrived at 5 am hoping for an early check in - the manager said as soon as housekeeping arrived they would get a room ready. We had breakfast while waiting and by 7 am we were in our room. A corner room with great view and huge bathroom. They even gave us a rollaway bed for our son even though we were expecting to share the king bed with him. Later we found out this was a deluxe room even though we had only booked a superior. The pool area is gorgeous - hardly anyone seemed to use it though. Absoutely spotless everywhere. Lot's of shops close by. We have rebooked for our stopover on the way home.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellerVera
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel in a great location. The hotel itself is fine, good rooms, all very clean and pleasant. Staff are friendly and efficient. The concierge was helpful in booking tours, providing a map etc. The restaurant (ground floor) has acceptable food, if a limited menu. The buffet is ok but you'd get tired of it pretty quickly. We didn't use the restaurant upstairs. However, it is not necessary to eat at the hotel as it is well-placed for several shopping malls with food halls and also the Riverside Walk (about 10 minutes stroDll away) with all of its dining choices. Several other hotels, including Raffles, are also within easy walking distance. Our only complaint would be the price of internet access. In the room it was 28 SD for 24 hours plug-in connection (over 10 sterling, 20 USD) and in the public area 12 SD (over 4 sterling, 8 US) for one hour, and this you have to purchase hour by hour - no avoiding the cutoff! Bearing in mind that 5 minutes walk away you can use an internet cafe for 3 SD an hour (uninterrrupted) the hotel charges feel like a rip-off. Overall I would definitely recommend Plaza Park, but avoid using the internet access until they drop the charges!

Reviews.Title: “Club rate not the best for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: Malingshu
Reviews.Content: I booked the Club rate for the Grand Plaza which provides dedicated rooms and services for business travellers. The advantages are free internet, use of dedicated club lounge, free breakfast, free cocktail hour, free 2 piece laundry per day, and personalised check-in service. The club staff are very helpful and friendly. The main disadvantages were: 1) the size of the room - a twin share is too small for colleagues to share. The only desk in the room is less than one foot from the end of the bed, which means either sitting on the bed to work, or sitting off to the side! It's hard to imagine how this could be presented as a workspace for business travellers. 2) Breakfast - the breakfast offering (in private club room) was appalling - barely warm eggs and bacon in a warming tray, cereal, sweaty cheese. 3) Internet access - free but slow and unreliable. I wouldn't recommend the club rate for people who intend to work in their rooms while on a business trip. The hotel would be a great option, however, for tourists because of its location.

Reviews.Title: “Stock standard business hotel...good location”
Reviews.Author: sethlad2
Reviews.Content: We booked a base room here for 3 nights (Fri-Mon). Check in was quick & professional,we were upgraded to a Club floor room,just room no benefits. Room had a work desk & a view of the Excelsior across the road although to the right you could see Fort Canning Park. Decent size with king size bed which was great. Bathroom had a bath with shower & a separate shower??? Had very little staff contact but concierge was cheerful & happy to help out with info.Cleaning staff were thorough & non intrusive. We never eat at hotels,especially in Singapore etc with great food everywhere so I cant comment about restaurants or breakfast ($24). Pool was small but clean & very quiet,didnt use the gym. Funan IT mall,City Hall MRT & Raffles SC are all 2 minutes away. Overall it was fine but I probably expected a little more for a hotel ranked so highly here.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money...”
Reviews.Author: airos
Reviews.Content: What an awful place. The rooms need major updating, I haven't seen a non-flat screen TV in a hotel room for ages. Tired-looking walls and hard, uncomfortable bed. Terrible service at breakfast - we were barked at by one of the staff that the buffet would be closing in 10 minutes. Slightly less efficient concierge than I would have liked. Will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PaulGDublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: We stopped over for two days in Singapore on our way to Australia and we were delighted that we chose this hotel to stay. It is very central to shopping, restaurants etc. The staff were particularly pleasant and could not do enough for us. The room was very large and well stocked. We somehow managed to join into the wedding party for the nightclub singer who was leaving to live in England and had a great night dancing, drinking and eating! I went to Singapore not expecting very much but came away very impressed with everything about the city and intend to go back again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: eastyover50
Reviews.Content: I am a first time traveller overseas with my husband, therefore we are comparing to 5 star accomodation in Australia. We read the reviews on all the hotels in Singapore and decided this was the hotel for us. The hotel was very clean, although the furnishings are getting old and need updating in the rooms and eating areas. We found the staff very accomodating and the buffet breakfast and dinner meals changed all the time. The hotel was central for all our travelling. The only bad comment, we were on a non smoking floor, yet the wardrobes smelt smoky. There was a cross section of travellers. When we go back to Singapore, we would stay again as good value for the price Over 50s from Adelaide

Reviews.Title: “Great centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Likes_to_travel42
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a very central position - a short walk to the MRT station and within walking distance of lots of the main attractions. As we stayed for 6 nights, we were given an upgraded room which overlooked the pool; it was spacious with a separate business area and large bathroom. We were also given complementary breakfast as we were staying for >3 nights. Overall the hotel was great - a good buffet breakfast and helpful staff. The pool area was small, but well kept and not crowded. This hotel is not expensive and we felt that it was excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay !”
Reviews.Author: Gijs33
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay (22/01/08-27/01/08) with Grand Plaza Park Hotel City Hall (Singapore) very much. First, we would say that the service from the staff is exemplary. Without fail, everybody greeted us friendlily at every occasion and quickly assisted us where ever possible. The positive and relaxed feel that radiated from all the staff was really amazing which is a true asset to the hotel. The quality of all facilities (the pool, lobby and breakfast service) easily met and exceeded all expectations and the rooms and appliances were surely adequate. Transportation was made very easy through a constant stream of taxis always present and the central location and the MRT only 1 block away made getting around Singapore very easy. The Grand Plaza Park Hotel City Hall (Singapore) set itself an exceedingly high standard that others in the industry can only aspire to, which made our stay very good value for money indeed. As we expect to be travel to Singapore more often in the near future, we will most certainly stay with them again (we've stayed with Copthorn Orchid and Waterfront before .... they simply don't compare .... different league all together) and we have no hesitation to recommend Grand Plaza Park Hotel City Hall to family, friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Successful stopover hotel”
Reviews.Author: heggos
Reviews.Content: We chose the Grand Plaza Park from the hotels on offer with the Singapore Airlines stopover package, after researching on Trip Advisor. Our stopover was on the return leg of our trip to Europe (flying back to Australia from Paris). We wanted a hotel that would provide a double and a twin room on a non-smoking floor(we are a family of 4), in a fairly central area (so we could walk to Chinatown, Little India, Clarke and Boat Quays etc), and with late check-out (as our flight out of Singapore was at 9.10 pm). We also wanted a hotel that would be pleasant enough to spend all weekend in, if we just wanted to hit the beds and stay there! (not knowing how tired we would be feeling after four weeks away and a number of flights). Our flight to Singapore got us in very early on a Saturday morning, so we were at the hotel at about 8.00am. The twin room was ready, and the staff were happy for us to move into it and wait for the double to be ready (suggesting that would be by 12.00 midday). Our teenage daughters went straight to bed, and my husband and I went for a walk to Chinatown. When we got back to the hotel at about 11.00, our room was ready. We found both rooms to be spacious, clean and well-presented, with very nice bathrooms. The beds were comfortable, and both rooms had pleasant views over the pool side of the hotel (we were on the 7th floor; the hotel is not too large with only 10 floors). We found all the staff at reception to be friendly and helpful, quick to offer assistance with luggage and with directions. Enjoyed the pool Saturday afternoon, after a walk to Little India and some hawker market food. After a really nice night out on the Saturday night (with a walk to Clarke Quay and dinner at Lotus Grill) we slept in til late on Sunday, checked out at 12.00, left our luggage in the reception area, went out for brunch at a sushi place nearby, then hung around the hotel for the afternoon. My husband and I had massages at the Spa attached to the hotel, leaving us time for happy hour drinks at the hotel bar before our transfer to the airport. This was a pretty idyllic stopover, and means that I will now never do a long haul flight again without breaking it up with some rest and relaxation!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent upper mid class for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Shaun321
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights on business January '08. At an average price per night of Sing $ 230, service and tax inclusive, this is excellent value. Perfectly located for business or pleasure, it offers great facilities, even if the rooms are smaller than previously experienced in comparable Singapore hotels. Rooms, however, very clean and bathroom huge in relation to the room, with both bath tub and walk in shower. Importantly (for me) in room iron provided as standard alongside the fully expected minibar, multichannel TV and high speed internet (fee liable but works!). Staff helpful and knowledgable, bars and restaurants good, although in Singapore, why stay in the hotel? A short walk to Clarke and Boat Quays gives a wonderful spectrum of eating and drinking opportunities. Would not hesitate to use again.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to top this one!”
Reviews.Author: DRC08
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel during a stopover between the UK and Australia. After an exhausting flight we arrived to one of the best hotels we've ever stayed in! Reception staff were great, and the hotel is extremely well presented. Our room was spotless with a HUGE bed and wonderful bathroom. Location was central, great shops about and only a short walk to the MRT. On departure the Porters could not do enough to help us. As frequent travellers between the UK and Australia, we need look no further for our hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Catherine_Ursula
Reviews.Content: The Grand Plaza was lovely! All the staff were very friendly, professional, and helpful. I was lucky to get an upgrade to a 9th floor room and to be able to check in early. The room was spotless, comfortable in size, with all the features you could want, including a control panel by the bed for lighting, air conditioning etc. The bathroom was lovely as well with moisturiser, toothbrush, ... The king size bed was huge and comfortable with lots of fluffy pillows and spotless sheets and quilts. I used the business centre and the internet access was fast, there are cheaper places around, but convenient to use the hotel.
